title: Great experiece
review: his army museum offers you a visual treat by displaying the vintage equipment used during the Indian wars tanks, weapons, guns, military vehicles etc. Good place for visit.

title: worth visiting
review: if you visit jaisalmer pls take time & visit the Longewala war memorial its a 2 hr drive, pay your homage to the brave soldiers who defended this post during 1971 war.

title: Must see
review: Bring tears to your eyes when you see relatively new but beautiful museum that provides sacrifices made by Indian armed forces in varius wars with brief history.

title: A Must Visit
review: Very well laid out, neat and clean, spotless clean place a typical trade mark of Indian Armed Forces, one gets transported to a different world on entering any Army establishment, as they are so well presented.

title: Very interesting
review: A small museum, partly in the open air. Very good explanations in excellent English. Displays include history of Indian Army from early days to now, WW1, WW2, Pakistan wars and the one with China. Lots of armoured vehicles outside from 1950's to 1990's and a Hawker Hunter on a pedestal. Spend up to an hour, it's only Rs30 entry.

title: Must visit
review: We visited here as we could not go to Longewala. This is a great war museum with huge collections and information. Visitors should not be allowed to jump on tanks like monkeys, it should be treated with utter respect. Must visit.

title: War Museum is FABULOUS
review: When you see the audio visual here it's sure to bring tears to your eyes. Indian soldiers are the BEST!!!

title: Related history
review: A beautifuly displayed kingdom essential . Old historical things can see here. Jaisalmer fort and houses built by yellow sandstone.

title: Salute to Forces
review: It is a must when visiting Jaisalmer. The Museum is maintained by the armed forces and is a must. There are tanks left by Pakistan Army as well as our own, the ones which we used. The   planes used by us. There is an audio-visual show (documentary). Unfortunately, they played 1965 was rather than 1971. There is a light and sound show however, since there were not many people the authorities decided to cancel it and it was one of the damp squibs. However, it was fantastic to be there.

title: Goose-bumps assured
review: We visited a war memorial for the first time and it was a memorable experience. The display of war tanks and equipment captured from enemies, the photographs, motto of our Jawans gave me goosebumps and tears at the same time. To learn more about the wars fought by the Indian Army across the years was fascinating. A must-go for every Indian visiting Rajasthan. As civilians, it's a rare opportunity to pray and thank in our hearts, all those brave hearts who make our lives safer and peaceful. Jai Hind.

title: light show
review: Evening Light and sound show, gave an inside information of past conflicts with Pakistan and China, and how and what happened from forst hand experience, very interesting and arousing Patriotism

title: the weapons kept are real and captured.
review: If you are someone who loves to see arms and ammunition this place is definitely for you. The place has an ample amount of weapons and tells you about the history of our country weapons. It also shows you a 5 min movie telling the strength of our Indian army. Wonderful place.JAI HIND!

title: War memorial museum
review: A very nice to place to visit when you are travelling from Jodhpur to Jaisalmer. It is located right on the highway. Nicely maintained and definitely take you back to the 1971 war with Pakistan. Feel very proud and nostalgic by the bravery of Indian soldiers. The  documentary film is a testimony of the courage and heroics of our soldiers.... Hats off.... A must see place in jaisalmer.

title: Don't miss
review: Lots of tanks n armoury all around, entire history of wars extensively covered by pics, inspiring quotes from the army, a short movie, a memorabilia shop n a canteen.. What more do u want

title: Good experience
review: This is slightly outside the City and a good museum in the memory of our soldiers. This is worth to spend some time and get to know our real heroes. They also show a small movie based on war and good for children to know about the country and army to instill the patriotism.

title: It's worth visiting this place
review: Food: They have limited items available in their foodcourt

title: Museum
review: A very beautiful and must visit place. The entry fees are very reasonable and the history preserved here is worth watching

title: Nice
review: A historical place for youngsters to knowing about Indian army & its weapon.. a fantastic

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: This is definitely one of the least touristy place in Jaisalmer. It is located 12 kms from the city.

title: High on Josh
review: for the patriotic and those not wanting to travel to the border, this is a good place to visit in the evening. Th museums, the tanks on display, the entire ambience and the grand finale of light and sound show is a high charge. Woth a visit.

title: 1971 war and Army heroics
review: Felt being blessed for visiting the place. Show cases the complete details excellently. Captions at various places over Rocks visible while you visit the entire place are worth inspiration to value the freedom we cherish at the expense of the sacrifices made by these greatmen

title: Visit to Jaisalmer War Museum
review: Absolutely go to place in Jaisalmer. The museum depicts all the sacrifices from the brave soldiers serving this Nation. Kids loved it to see the war artilleries and the photographs speaking out loud of the martyrs.

title: Feels proud!
review: Amazing atmosphere. You will feel proud of your country at every given point of time!

title: Pride of army
review: A must visit place with children so that they understand the sacrifices of our beloved soldiers have done to our nation. Goosebumps assured. Don't miss the short movie and buy sovenier from the shop as it's worth more than money.

title: We felt our patriotic feelings at its peak
review: Great place.  A must visit for every indian.  We were moved to tears reading the last letter...i dont have words to describe the greatness of these soldiers and army men...though a bit far from the city, every indian should take some time off to know what our brave soldiers are doing for our country....Hats off...

title: Nice place
review: Little far from jaisalmer but worth a visit .kids enjoyed it ..nice bit of history of our Indian soldiers life and sacrifices..tells about various fights with Pak and about longewalla fight.. time well spent..

title: Please Visit Jaisalmer War Museum
review: A Place Dedicated for our Indo-Pak War Heroes for Bangladesh Formation. A must see place for true Patriot

title: Family Holiday
review: Now this is the one of the best place to visit once in Jaisalmer. Amazing place to visit and must visit place.. You feel so proud that what our Ay has done for us till date and the sacrifices they had done for the Nation.. Salute to all Brave Heart Soldiers Of Indian Army.

title: Ok ok war museum
review: It is 10 kms outside city. Most fascinating part of this museum  is that it has Pakistani tanks captured  by Indian army in 1971 war, and the aircraft using which we won 1971 war

title: Rajasthan tour
review: Real salute to those who have surrendered their life for us. A must  place every Indian should see. It's on the way to Jaisalmer highway which you can not miss.

title: War Museum
review: A must visit place when you are travelling with kids , teenagers ,or on a school  college trip. Closing time is 8 PM , Must Spare one evening ( 5 to 8) when u r in Jaisalmer. Don't miss it's light sound show ( 100Rs  per Adult no fees for kids below 6) . It has everything you  want your kids to know about indian army bravoury . Good souvenir shop as well.

title: Patriotic
review: Reviews war through eyes of a soldier. Excellent narratives to inculcate true patriotism amongst Indians. Must visit.

title: Must visit
review: War museum has all details of war wirh pakistan which shows our soldiers sacrifice. One should must visit this place and admire them. Night show is also good.. Entry fees is 30 ₹ PP. and for show its 100₹ PP. Per person.

title: A rare kind of museum
review: A one of a kind museum. It has tanks, aircraft and armored vehicles used in Indo-Pak war 1965. And even more unique are the exhibits of tanks and armored vehicles SEIZED from Pakistan in the war of 1965. There is a paid film show which is boring and so clearly avoidable.

title: not much to see
review: It's all about the various wars between India and Pakistan.  Lots of one sided nationalist information.   Not really much for a foreign tourist to see.  skip it.

title: Million salutes to our real heroes, visit to this battleground
review: This place provide good memory of war against Pakistan. It has lots of occupied vehicle during war in display. Short movie is awesome providing actual scenario of war.

title: Must go..!! Get a different feeling..
review: The museum is located on Jodhpur- Jaiselmer High way . A well maintained and systematic constructed museum , it shows photos, weapons, and details of various wars fought so far .

title: Tankers
review: nice and historic musium and you visit and doing photography and take some history knowege thanks and need more info for visit in youtube saubhik vishwas vlogs&films  and saubhik photography in facebook

title: Do consider
review: Good to go it has war tanks, museum some good shopping options ,handmade stuff made by solider family and many more

title: Nice place and show
review: It's a small area opened for public , it's enroute Jodhpur. They show a nice 20 min video. Recommended for being reminded of our soldiers. Must visit.

title: Departure Experience of jaisalmer
review: The Jaisalmer War Museum was conceived by Lieutenant General Bobby Mathews, AVSM, VSM, General Officer Commanding, Desert Corps and constructed by the Desert Corps of the Indian Army.

title: Feel proud at this museum
review: * Good for kids to show the war weapons, tools, dresses and vehicles.

title: Visit
review: We visited this place recently. Being a holiday & tourist season the ticket counter was utter kaotic. Finally we could go around the place. There were few tanks captured from Pakistani army & a hall with photos & medals. It is well kept. Even AV show was overcrowded.

title: gOOD FAMILY VISIT
review: Good inspirational and family visit .Lots of defense artillery on display. Well maintained by the Army.

title: War Museum
review: Must visit place. The place is maintained very well. You can take return auto Rs. 150/- and waiting for 1 hour. Film show is not recommended.

title: Excellent war memorial
review: Just before enter the Jaisalmer city visit the war memorial. very nicely maintained. please see the video show. The vehicles/tanks captured from enemy pakistan are displayed there.

title: A novel army museum worth a visit
review: We had visited on an October late morning and it was really hot but it did not deter us from seeing the whole complex in the scorching sun. A great effort by the Indian Army to document its evolution prior to independence to present day & great coverage of the wars. Also few captured tanks and other equipment of the Pakistan army captured during the Longewala War are displayed in the open. A documentary is also shown every 20 min which is really a good thing to watch. Also there is a good souvenir shop and also a canteen for simple food options.

title: Matter of Indian Pride
review: Just 12 km near Jaisalmer is this super sensational place to remember and pay homage to the countless Indian Soldiers who have been protecting our great nation

title: Must Visit
review: U'll feel like Real Indian and will be excited to hear about our army and their missions... Brave soldiers who laid down their lives for mother India...

title: Jaisalmer War Museum
review: Jaisalmer War Museum, is such a proud feeling place. every one should have to visit this place. you should have to pay for entry in this. well maintained place and you will feel proud on Indian army for their sacrifices for saving our country from enemy.

title: Superb War museum by our Indian Army
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and haven't been to War museum then your trip is incomplete. There's so much to know about the Indian Army and the wars which India has won against Pakistan. There's a tank which India has won from Pakistan and lots more to see. The fighter jets, tanks, artilleries, vehicles etc are so well displayed here, it will fill you up with patriotism. A video is also presented here. And all this you can see at a very affordable rate. I am truly impressed with this museum.

title: Must see
review: If u have to know the history of Indian military during the Indo Pak war then u must visit this place.they show the short film on 1965 war n  tanks , fighter planes captured by india

title: Very Good Museum
review: Jaisalmer War Museum showcases the valiant Indian Army and has lots of information on the Indo Pak Wars of 1965 and 1971. The various artifacts, models and information boards are very well displayed. There is also a gift shop to buy souvenirs. The museum is maintained very well by the Indian Army.

title: Must visit place if you are interested in war history
review: The place has well maintained sections of everything related to 1965 and 1971 wars and the guide inside provides you good insight into the artifacts placed. There is also short audio visual played regd 1965 war which after watching makes you proud of our army accomplishments.

title: Jaisalmer War Museum
review: Yes war museum means history related to our militarist, warriors, how they fought and collection of war related stuffs, good collection.

title: Must Visit the War Museum at Jaisalmer
review: Very tastefully done, touching al the lives of theTrue Hero's of our land/ country - and there is a short Movie just fro 12 minutes - you must not miss it!

title: Amazing experience
review: I would say please visit this place, it would be a nice experience for young kids who are not aware of the wars fount and sacrifices made by the Indian Army.

title: Visit to Dessert war memorial
review: The war memorial is good. But mostly photos only. Some Pakistani tanks on display. It is on jaisalmer Falodi highway just out side of the Jaisalmer town. It is newly built and well maintained. Ticket price is ok but guide price is too high and you don't require it.

title: Well Made Museum, Jai Hind- thanks
review: We stopped on the way to Jaisalmer and initially thought can cover in 10-15mins and move on. It has a ticket price of 50rs per head. We realized its worth the visit. It has many pak abandoned War tankers, fighter planes etc. Also there is a depiction of bunker, many other war sites. We also watched a movie of war. I would suggest u can give a miss to movie if running against time. Also there is gift shop.

title: Amazing experience!
review: This was a surprise stop on the way to jaisalmer. Having been always fascinated by the battle tanks, seeing these beasts out in the open was a warm welcome to the wer museum. See the proud heritage and a glorious history of lndian army.

title: patriotism
review: very well build   and maintained

title: History Meets the present
review: Well maintained... Clear information vedio pictures of the various wars fought by the Indian Army can be seen... Various ammunition used in the past and those used in the present along with varied complete attire of the army can be seen ... There is also a gift shop in the premise where one can purchase stuff such as bags... Handicraft items made by wife's of the soldiers... They only accept card ... Most of the items were reasonably priced and of very good quality...

title: MR D.CHAKRABARTY
review: Since I am going to visit jaishalmer very shortly so the culinary experience I have about the restaurant became nostalgic..

title: Patriotic place
review: Its a very good place to know about the Indo-pak and other wars. It has a lot of information and would recommend this place.

title: Place to know your army and what they do
review: Its one of the War Museum in Rajasthan having tanks, which presents glory of Indian army and war they had in past with neighbouring countries.

So much to learn about our brave hearts who laid down their lives for our nation. A must for all to stop by and get a glimpse of the awesome museum. There is a nice souvenir shop and a cafe too.

title: great place
review: it was one of the great places in jaisalmer. do try to go there after checking the schedule of documentaries and the laser show.

title: Place where u feel proud
review: It is a must visit sightseeing spot just 12kms before Jaisalmer. Open from 10am to 6pm. It depicts the valour with which our Defense forces fought the Longewala Battle against Pakistan. A short 15min video is shown every half an hour.

title: Superb maintained depicting our engagements with Pakistan..
review: On the highway just before entering Jaisalmer. Should visit this to see the sacrifices of our soldiers. Spend at least a hour or so going through various war exhibits and see a 20 minute movie as well.

title: Jai Hind
review: Great History of our Indian Army,  While visiting there it makes my visit very amazing,  I feel Proud To Be An Indian,  Highly recommended of travelers..

title: Salute
review: War museum has great history of Indian army , memorable trip in jaisalmer. How over solider are working for our nation , thanks from over heart...

title: Excellent History & Display Of Weapons
review: I Like history and this was perfect place, they also have a 15 minute short video of various India War with pakistan and china.

title: Proud to be Indian
review: Beautiful ambiance, walls showing sacrifices made by our Jawans, surrended by General Niazi of Pakistan and various pictures and souvenir shop, are praiseworthy.

title: Amazing Visit
review: We enjoyed here. On the way from Jaislamer to Jodhpur this museum some of the history of the the Indian Army. Very well managed and preserved war. Highly recommended.

title: Jaisalmer war museum.
review: A must visit place while visiting Jaisalmer. Makes us realise the heroism and sacrifices of our soldiers. We are really proud of them.

title: Nice
review: Super place to see in Jaisalmer ........and place was very nice and pic ground and in site place is nice

title: Historical war Museum
review: The Indian army has set up a historical war museum in Jaisalmer. This is a unique and well laid out museum complete with AC coffee shop and a Souvenir corner.

title: Feel proud
review: The Museum is on the way to Jodhpur to Jaisalmer (10km before Jaisalmer). It is latest attraction in Jaisalmer and a must watch for all the visitors to Jaisalmer.Excellently preserved weapons, thanks etc

title: Visit if you are a war buff...
review: Situated on the highway to Jodhpur, this is spread across a huge area. Most of the exhibitions are indoors. It has an extensive collection of ammunition dating back to British era to the recent artillery. There are small write ups of all the brave soldiers and their inspiring stories, there are stories of few incidents of the past wars that are quite gripping. Children will surely enjoy a visit to this place. The tanks, jeeps and the war planes are kept on the outdoor. Please check the timing of the visit. It takes about an hour to finish the tour.

title: Best War museum
review: I have never seen that much great War Museum. Its very nice place to visit if you are there in Jaisalmer. Very peaceful place. Best for kids and young generation to boost up their moral

title: Fridom fighters
review: Very nice musium.see with family and friends.very location on the road of jodhpur.few km before Jaisalmer city .

title: Mindblowing
review: Visited the Place with my family, the Army shown us the Video Footage of War between India & Pakistan & how we won the War. The Museum is having the Photos of Pakistani Army surrendered to Indian Army. The Tanks which captured by Pak Army are also in this place.

title: Informative and Interesting
review: Must go lot of know-how of various war our forces has fought, with Maps and detail comments.

title: War Museum
review: Good Place to travel and understand the nitty gritty of our indo pak wars, its a good place to have the knowledge about it..one should travel here

title: Worth Visiting at least once to for renewed patriotism!!!
review: If you are visiting Jaisalmer or passing nearly, then it is a must visit for you. As a war memorial, it has a enviable collection of arms ammunitions and lots of historical facts and figures which could surely enrich your knowledge of Indian warfare in recent past. If you are History buff, you would simply love it. Do not miss out the projection show which continue happen throughout the day at a certain frequency. The artefacts are well organized and you will find it too easy to understand the set up quite easily. The place is completely owned and maintained by Indian military and hence you will find it is quite well guarded and maintained. There is a souvenir shop with a good collection of items. If you have an inclination for memorabilia and collectibles, you must spend few minutes at least!!! Overall, this is a place you should include your itinerary if you are not in a time crunch.

title: Jaisalmer VIsit
review: Visited with Family, good knowledgeable museum,lot of places for the photographs,this destination was not in the list but when we visited the place it was pretty good

title: Lights and sound show
review: Lights and sound show being organized in jaisalmeer war muesum .

title: Jawaan guides through war memorial
review: The war memorial holds amazing information about the war between India and Pakistan. The force deployed there are the same people who guide us through the memorial and explain everything. It is a must visit place.

title: Vande Mataram
review: This war museum is approximately 15km before you reach Jaisalmer on the Jaisalmer-jodhpur highway.The entire tour of this museum would take around 1 to 1 1/2hrs.This includes stories of our brave freedom fighters over the years which will definitely stir the patriotism in you.They also provide guide facility for a nominal fee,and you’ll be overwhelmed to listen from them who have given their all in the battlefield.The museum tour also includes a video or a short film showing our .The museum displays vehicles and equipments of Indian army as well as those of the Pakistan army captured during the war.Besides this there is an honor wall with the list of all our brave soldiers who were bestowed with Param Vir Chakra,Maha Vir Chakra for their valiant efforts in service of the nation.

title: Must visit
review: If you are in jaisalmer...one should visit this museum...well maintained..entry fees is minimal...the souvenir shop offers many things which one can buy at a reasonable rate...overall a great place to visit and should not be missed...

title: A must visit place
review: It hosts the war museum with original captured battle tanks and vehicles during wars with the neighbour.A great opportunity to have photo s with these battlefield machinery. A great depiction of our war heroes is there.

review: Site of longewala war. Has two tanks and 2guns.shows a video both from movie border and actual clipping. Could have been better if it had a few more military hardware. review: Must visit

title: Jaisalmer war memorial
review: Museum by army.. showing video of our brave soldiers.. collection of tanks also one army shop where you can buy clothes or decoratove items.

title: Salute to all the Soldiers on the border who protect us.
review: The War Museum gives you first hand experience of what our troops at the Border do ( Uniforms, weapons, communication etc.)

title: Nice exhibits
review: Great museum. Well laid out and well presented. Lots of information and exhibits. There was a war movie also

title: Good museum
review: This is good war museum, near to Jaisalmer city. Museum is very good. Pakistani captured tanks are kept here.

title: Get a feel of the 1971 War
review: Still under development, the Jaisalmer War Museum consists of Memorial of the 1971 Indo-Pak War. You can find the Tanks used by both the involved armies of the respective countries. Also there is present the replica of the Hunter Aircraft used by the Indian Air Force during the Longewala Battle.

title: Jai hind
review: Must visit place..documntry is very good...we enjyed this place. .andr se feelng aati h ki hmari army kitna kuch krti h hmare liye..jai hind

title: Very nice
review: Worth a visit. Beautifully maintained.  Displays are excellent.  The audiovisual presentation is also very good.

title: EXCELLENT
review: if you are visiting jaisalmer India Pak Boarder then you must visit this place on the way coming back from boarder.

title: Emotional and thrilling
review: A must visit place, abt 12-15 kms from city, auto took 300 for this museum, gadisar lake n back to hotel. No words can describe the feeling u get here. Hire guide for 100, they r from army staff and really helpful

title: Walk through the past
review: Museum is maintained well. Few captured patton tanks are among the exhibits. Entry is not free but you can spend 30-45 minutes here.

title: Gem of a Place
review: On Jodhpur Jaisalmer Road before Military Station

title: Well maintained war museum
review: Its on Jodhpur-Jaisalmer highway closer to Jaisalmer city. It has tanks, planes and other vehicles used in 1965 and 1971 war. Good information about Punjab regiment  and a hall dedicated to Laungewala battle fought/won in 1971.

title: For the Patriotic Indian Citizens...a matter of Pride!
review: Probably a new concept for the Indian audiences...but we have many similar institutes back home...So we get the concept.

title: Interesting..must visit
review: Must visit place if you happen to be in Jaisalmer

title: Excellent stopover.
review: We werent aware of this spot, but thank God to have it visited . Maintained spic and span, showcasing in great details about our armed forces. Not seen many such memorials at tourist destinations. Really its worth seeing.

title: A place that every Indian should visit
review: No visit to Jaisalmer can be complete without a visit to this war museum. Gives very good information about our armed forces and the various wars they have fought. Do take the guided tours available.A place that makes you feel proud to be an Indian

title: 10 out of 5!
review: Must visit! Difficult to sum up the place and emotions attached! Contributions done by our soldiers need applause and respect!

title: Jaisalmer War Museum
review: A place to add during Jaisalmer tour. The War museum is dedicated to the 1971 War between India and Pakistan. During the visit, you also get to watch a real Movie of this Indo-Pak War. Nice collections of photographs war equipments.. War captured tankers and Jeeps of enemies.  It also hosts a very good restaurant, souvenir purchasing section, an indoor and outdoor museum and a video presentation. very good Parking place is available and the entry fee is nominal.

title: Rather interesting
review: This museum gives you quite a good overview over the history of the Indian army and the wars the army was involved in especially since 1947, when India became a sovereign nation. Just keep in mind that this museum tells the story only from the point of view of India and its war heroes.

title: Unique War Museum
review: I went to Jaisalmer War Museum. The museum covers an area of over 10 acres of land. It has two large Information Display Halls, an Audio Visual Room and a souvenir shop. Apart from the evolution of the Indian Army, the museum showcases tales of bravery and sacrifice of heroes of the wars. It is great place to go.

title: Superb- More than just a Museum
review: Located at little away from main city with beautiful roads. Must visit place. You can see real tanks of Ind and Pak here, a big Indian flag, a bigg knife and area with beautiful greenery inside. You can buy 2 tickets- one for museum and other for a short movie. You can take as many photographs with everything. (All these tanks came from Longewala as that location is too far so gov made available all these here).

title: Sense of gratitude emerges when you visit this museum.
review: Feel touched by the courage and sacrifice made by our Indian soldiers over the years, the tradition of valour and service is highlighted at this . A must visit place for every peace loving human being .

title: Lots of tanks and other vehicles on display
review: Driving to Jaisalmer on the main highway do not miss stopping by at this war museum/memorial.  It honors the bravery of Indian soldiers who fought in the wars with Pakistan.  The many trucks, tanks, canons on display were captured in those wars.

title: Main Attraction Of Longewala
review: Good to watch the small film (15 mins)here and then see some equipment used in war . Film -Rs 25 per person, Free for Army families.

title: One kind of experience
review: One should visit such to understand the sacrifice, the fight for freedom, and to feel the connection to country , Countrymen especially army men.

title: Best place in Jaisalmer
review: A wonderful place to see the Armed Forces deed of gallantry & valor. There is a Souvenir shop which sells good quality accessories with the War Museum's logo. A nice place to visit. ne of the few places in India where you can touch and see a variety of tanks and other armored vehicles so up close. Please take the guide or audio guide if you want to know everything.

title: Good museum
review: There are tanks and trucks, guns captured during 71 war,  even u can buy things from the souvenir shop like clothes, bags , wooden items , hip flask etc.They also have war movie room & cafeteria .

title: Very patriotic feeling you get..!
review: Too good a museum this is. They have kept actual weapons used in the previous wars, and also the tanks/trucks used by India/Pakistan in the wars. Quite nice campus. Very clean and well maintained by army. There is entry fees  of Rs.30/- per person, and if you are going to view the video of history here, then I believe extra fees of Rs.50/- is there. I don't remember this quite since we were in hurry and there was long queue outside video gallery as there is limited seating there.

title: War Memorial
review: Excellent Museum maintained by Indian Army. A must visit place while going to Jaisalmer. You will have glimpse of past war fought by Indian Army.

title: Come again here.
review: The Jaisalmer war museum is the most beautiful part of the Jaisalmer tourism. So nice and relaxing here.Plese visiting here everyone.

title: Feel proud by visiting
review: The place gives a great feeling. A must place to visit for every Indian 15 km from jaisalmer. I went with a bike it closes by 6 pm

title: A must visit if you are visiting Jaisalmer
review: Really liked the place. Neat, clean and good collection of informative articles in the museum and lot of tanks to take pictures with.

title: Good for one time visit
review: We went to this place on our way from Jaisalmer to BIkaner. Its a nice place depicting the war scenes.

title: Amazing historical details of Indian Army
review: We visited the Museum after Laungewala war memorial, so we thought we knew most of it but there was much more to it. Moreover, the movie played here was more closer to reality. All collections and histories mentioned on the walls are pretty detailed ones and interesting

title: Brave soldiers
review: The jaiselmer was good and had a very patriotic sensation. The exhibition was informative but the most splendid thing was the audio visual movie. It was very emotional but also very courage filled. Don't forget to touch the sand and feel the nationalism inside you and to feel proud to be an Indian. Jai Hind

title: A nice place
review: A nice place o visit, Will not take more than an hour. Good to know about the wars that india has taken part into and also to learn about the bravehearts who have fought for the country.

title: must visit with kids
review: very informative attraction for young kids to get patriotic feeling. my 6yr old son enjoyed a lot . capturing pics with tanks is like bonus. restaurant inside is very good too.

title: Place which you should be of Pride off
review: One must visit this place to get educated on various aspects of our Army. Their audio visual is quite good. Various tanks and equipment captured by our army are real monuments.

title: WOW- BORDER OUT POST
review: Border just few kms away.  The place actually which was attacked by Pakistan in 1971.  completely under military control.  You can actually feel the pressure in the air.  must visit.  You immediately connect with the place.  Do not forget to visit the Video room, where a 15 mins documentary is shown about the battel of Longewalla

title: For those interested in the history of the ‘65 and’71 wars
review: About 9 km out of Jaisalmer,on the jaisalmer jodhpur highway,this museum is worth a visit.The grounds have many tanks and fighter planes used in the wars.The museum tells the history of the wars and the various conflicts in Kargil and Siachen.Very popular for school excursions too. Movies on the war are shown in an auditorium for which separate tickets are required.

title: History was written here
review: Documents the wars that India has fought and also displays some of the destroyed tanks. For young children its a good place to see what happened in the past and learn

title: Worthwhile museum, but the gift shop a bit of a nightmare
review: Russian tanks and other armed vehicles on display.  Two main exhibitions - one on the history of the Indian Army which is refreshingly neutral about its East India Company and British Army origins. The second exhibition is a very detailed account of the two Indo-Pak conflicts and the Sino-Indian war.  The language is rather gung-ho, but overall the quality of presentation is good.

title: Wow.. Amazing.. Loved the museum..
review: It's a must visit place especially for Indians. It glorifies the tale of our army persons who laid there life saving this country. It has a display of all the wars India fought with all the details and equipment. Better take out some time and watch the war movie shown here. Salute to our army.

title: Don't waste your time here
review: To call it a museum is a travesty. 2 miserable rooms with some pictures and some artifacts. Looks like a middle school science project. Indian Army/Airforce/Navy has such a rich history and the story could have been told in a much better way. The 15 minute movie sounded like a propaganda rather than a historical narrative and the projector was terrible.

title: Osm journey
review: Its really a great experience ...I proud to Indian forces...when I been there i saw a lot of tanks of Pakistan in Indian musium...its is a great place u must come here and see...

title: A must visit for any citizen
review: If you want to re-inforce your patriotic feelings, there is nothing better than a visit to this war museum. It's dedicated to 1971 war. Spend some time absorbing our glorious war history, see the short 10 minute movie on the war, take your pics with many war tanks and other machines on display in gorunds.

title: Nice war artefacts
review: visited this nice museum. Good war time artefacts including tanks. Must visit to get a feel of pride

title: It reignites National feelings
review: Beautifully built and aesthetically maintained. This place is a must visit place while you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Amazing place
review: One of the best places to visit while in Jaisalmer. Do ensure you take a guided tour. You will cherish the weapons and witness the heroism of our Jawans who ensure we sleep well while they guard the borders.

title: its an one of many museum
review: This kind of museums you find very rarely. It is war museum with all the different machinary used in 1971 Indo Pak war. Each equipment has a board with detail description which gives lot of information. I recommend this if you want a feel of seeing museum other than regular ones.

title: Nice place, National Pride.
review: This place is nicely maintained, having things related to the extreme efforts done by our forces. Salute to our forces of our country India!!

title: Excellent museum to know complete details of the India-Pakistan war of 1971
review: Hats off to the Indian Army for putting up such an amazing war museum. Located about 14 kms from the Jaisalmer city on the main Jaisalmer-Jodhpur road, this is a must visit place.

title: Must visit, on highway to Jaisalmer
review: This is a must visit place. This is right on the highway.

title: EXCEPTIONAL CONNECT WITH THE 1971 WAR LOGS
review: Must visit place for all indians to see a page from the 1971 war diaries. Its all done from local resources, so hats off to the people who made it possible. Must visit for all patriots who wanna see the emotions of the 1971 war and the battle of Laungewala.

title: Interesting even for foreigners
review: Having overtaken what felt like half the Indian Army on the road to Jaisalmer we had an incentive to learn more about the military. The museum has two main pavilions covering the history of the army as well as the many incidents with Pakistan. Displays were in English.

title: Will fill you with pride
review: The place is around 12km from Jaisalmer city. It is operated by Indian Army.

title: Very Exciting place to visit
review: Enjoyed visit to very exciting place.The important place to visit, Good maintain, nicely exhibited war equipments, we feel very proud by seeing and understanding the displayed articles. To buy momentos is good which are at reasonable rates and qualitative. enjoyed place.

title: Leave the place with pride
review: On the road from Bikaner to Jaisalmer, this place houses some of the history of the Indian Army. Stumbled upon it by chance and there are no regrets. There is a short film on the conflicts with Pakistan and some war trophies in the form of Pakistan tanks, trucks etc. It also sheds light on the Indian Army's history and its wars with Pakistan. On a whole you leave the place filled with patriotism and saluting the Indian defence personals.

title: I love Army
review: This is New Zealand special for me I never been like that Army Museum first time I visit Army Museum son pressing I love India I love my other

title: Good
review: This is great place historical about Indian Army I very impressing so much thanks for Indian Army up in the Jaisalmer then you come this place I recommend for you very hardly

title: Must visit while in Jaisalmer
review: Loved reading the history of the armed forces and details of important victories. Especially the testimonials and letters of soldiers.

title: Best experience in Jaisalmer, one of its kind, must visit
review: I visited war museum with least expectations but was surprised to see that our war history is depicted and maintained so beautifully. My son loved to see the flighter aircraft. Having grown up in defence surroundings, I really enjoyed seeing the various Tanks, recovery vehicles, radar, battle gun and the history around it. There is a video featuring the 1971 war fought at Longewala post and is a must see. You may see the same video if you visit Longewala post. There is a small canteen where you may also enjoy some coffee and snacks. Must visit.

title: Strict yet hospitable
review: Absolutely worth visiting. One can book an Auto or car from the city and reach this place on the outskirts in about 30 mins.

title: Amazing Visit - Addressed about Army Weapons
review: We enjoyed nice time  to explore our knowledge about War Meseum. Very Good Museum. Army tanks, weapons, busts of martyrs a short video on achievement of indian forces..its place worth visiting, Great time enjoyed

title: Amazing place
review: Very unique and interesting place . Multiple tanks and weapons are at display along with 2 hallways depicting bravery of our army men.

title: wake up your patriotism
review: lovely place to know about milatary and forces. lots of information you have about soliders in crucial time of 65 and 71. entire museum indicates the sacrifice of Indian army. salutes to all our heroes.

title: A great place which gives lot of information about glory of Indian Army
review: Nice place where you can get information about the wars fought by the Indian Army. The place shows captured Pakistani tanks

title: A place of pride!
review: Around 10 kms prior to Jaisalmer on the Jaisalmer – Jodhpur Highway, is the ‘Jaisalmer War Museum’. This museum highlights the bravery, extraordinary courage and valour of the war heroes especially from the state of Rajasthan. It traces various milestones of Indian Armed Forces. Major attraction was the 10 minutes’ video that showcases the glorious history of victories. Multiple tanks and weapons are at display. They also have a gift store.

title: Proud fill moment
review: Yes, this is the place where every Indian fill proud on our Soldiers  and our country. Specially  the watching film on 1966 war between India-pak. Must see place in Jaisalmer

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: I have not seen many army museums. I was not sure what to expect but was overwhelmed by what I saw. The place is about 8 km from Jaisalmer town. One needs to buy entry ticket. There is guide available if we make payment of Rs 100. The guide is actually serving officer of army. However the one we engaged told us only the information that is anyways displayed on the walls. I was expecting a bit more information such as information on tanks, and on some behind the scenes war drama etc. which did not come. The flip side of guide is that the tours are limited, one needs to wait long for time slots, also once you are with guide, you are rushed to cover the entire thing is 20-30 minutes. Since additional information is not coming avoid the guide. This way you can cover the museum at length and at your own pace. I was appalled by the indiscipline exhibited by visitors. They stood contrast to disciplined army soldiers who were extremly patient and tolerant. There is memorabilia shop where you can pick up good quality T shirts at extremely low cost.    A must visit if you are in this part of country

title: Good museum
review: A really good museum where you can witness things about 1971 Indo-Pak war. Earlier it was located far away from from Jaisalmer but now its easily accessible.

title: Must visit on the main Highway
review: Must visit this place. THere is a short film about the 64 and 71 war and there are lot of tanks and planes on display (both indian and captured pakistani). Tons of details about the indian army and various regiments involved in conflicts in that area. Commendable effort by the army to manage that place in the searing heat. Jai Hind.

title: Feel the spirits- Visit the war museum at jaisalmer
review: We had a good time spent in this war museum. WE had also seen the war memorial at Longewala but this one stands out. They have a museum and the lady over there was explaining all the things displayed in the museum, how india fought the 1971 war against Pakistan, Who were the real war heroes etc. Weapons used in the 1971 war was also displayed. We had seen a short movie depicting the bravery of Indian soldiers which will definitely raise your hairs. There is a good souvener shop where you can buy T shirts , Caps, and some artifacts.Outside they have displayed some of teh old aircrafts, Tanks seized from pakistani forces in the war , An old mobile radar station etc.There is a small cafeteria also.Worth a visit for all patriots who visits jaisalmer.

title: Captured pakistani Tanks and tributes to martyrs at war muesum
review: The Museum is very near to Jaisalmer town. Its a small green oasis in the desert. It shows a movie about our martyrs in battle of 1972. There is a small store with memoirs. A little snack house served great pakoras

title: Informative
review: 15mins video of Indian Army's bravery in 1965 war. Informations and pictures of several other major wars and specially the 1971 war in which Longewala-Jaisalmer was a key spot. Engage in conversations with army personnel to get further information. Feels proud for our Army and country.

title: Great Place of Memories of India's War's
review: Dont Miss the Visit to War Museum. Audio-visual Tour is just awesome. Brings Goosebumps to all. Take Guide for better understanding.

title: Fascinating History
review: This museum traces the evolution of the Indian Army and was inaugurated by Lieutenant General Ashok Singh, General Officer Commanding in Chief, Southern Command. The museum has an audio visual room, two display halls,and a souvenir shop. In the audio visual room you will see a movie that charts the history of the Indian army and covers one of the first major engagements in the western sector during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, fought between assaulting Pakistani forces and Indian defenders at the Indian border post of Longewala, in the Thar Desert of Rajasthan. Artefacts include old british weapons, tanks and even an aeroplane! Well worth a visit the video is fascinating.

title: WAR MEMORIAL  ....SALUTE TO INDIAN ARMY
review: on the way from jodhpur to jaisalmer ..its located hardly 8 km before Jaisalmer city.

title: war museum
review: Good place to visit. good for kids to know war history and see old war weapons and tanks etc. fill us with a sense of pride for our brave army

title: Nice museum
review: We have spent good time at this museum.

title: Arms, Tanks and history
review: This is well managed museum displaying real weapons. Some of them captured from enemy forces. They also have a souvenir shop and a basic restaurant. Its on the highway itself so no detour. Its worth visiting, specially its very exciting to watch tanks from so close.

title: Jaisalmer - Loungewala 1971 War Museum
review: Excellent war museum to memorize the incomparable efforts, patriotism and courage of India Army. This war was won by India against pakistan. Bollywood movie Border was based on 1971 Battle of Loungewala.War museum consists of military equipments, tanks, aircrafts, bomb launchers, military artillery & make over of siachin & other extreme condition faced by defence forces.

title: Nice fotage of india pakistan war
review: this is also a great place to visit to know about war between india pakistan 1971.

title: Excellent Place
review: This place consists a war memorial of India Vs Pak and China by Indian Army . there is also a short film on Indias war memorials

title: Yaad karo wo qurwani!!!
review: This place is before entering the Jaisalmer city, when you come from Jodhpur. This place have entry fee of 20 only for Indian.

title: Proud to be an indian
review: This is located on the way to Sam desert from Jaisalmer city. Jaisalmer war museum is a great place to know all about Indo Pak war (1971). Obviously it’s a very well maintain museum by Indian army. Please do not miss out this place

title: Well maintained !
review: You can visit this museum while on your way into Jaisalmer from Jodhpur or while travelling back to Jodhpur from Jaisalmer.

title: Inspiring museum
review: It gives  you wonderful feeling  with A big Tricolour  fluttering  amidst display  of  war  tanks  & vehicles > The  museum which gives a brief  history of our  Nation''s  wars & the  sacrifices  made by our  soldiers gives you  goosebumps.

title: Gives feel good factor while visiting the war museum
review: Museum was very close to Jaisalmer city, on highway. They have a nice collection of real stuff that were/are used during war. Also, there are a good number of various military tanks including one that was captured from Pakistan.

title: Military History
review: Take some time to read the captions to fully get a view into the Indian Army and its operations. It's a little out of the city but if you like military history, it's definitely worth a visit.

title: jai hind
review: where citizen of India should and must visit this place , where we will get to know how our men given their life for our protection . feel proud

title: Must visit
review: Do not miss the video show. There is a large collection of tanks. You can see a big tri-colour flag. You can get a feeling of our soldiers life. The various army uniforms are on display with the weapons used by the army. There is a list of soldiers who have won the Param Vir and Maha Vir Chakra with the year they won it.

title: A moving reminder of the '71 War
review: Battleground of the India-Pak '71 War; reminder of the heroics of the Indian Army. The museum has Pak tanks that had entered Indian territory. There's a small film that they play, it moves you to tears when you watch the bravery displayed by the Indian soldiers, prepared to defend their posts until death

title: Excellent Military Museum
review: This Museum has an apt place in the 25 Best Museums of Asia, as it showcases the Valour and Glory of the Indian Army right through. It is an inspiration to the Youth of India and a Pride for our Country where many foreign tourists too visit. The amenities and Souvenir Shop are good too. More War Memorabilia are in the process of being added to the Museum; as one can see old vehicles and war equipment being parked nearby. Good place to visit if you are visiting Jaisalmer

title: Feel proud
review: Superb place. A historic place where we know about history. War museum great place for children. Students really wana to this place.

title: refreshes 1971 Indo-pak war memories
review: real tribute to our war heros,excellent audio visual show,display of pakistani captured tanks,photographs,medals very well displayed our heros got and we feel high proud for our soldiers who laid down their lives for coutry

title: A tribute of Fallen Heroes
review: We visited this place and was elt proud after seeing the histoary and sacrifices made by Indian Army. A must visit place to see , Also watch the Video which they shows about the war. You can also also have a lot of pictures clicked with Tanks. Planes. etc.

title: Proud to have visited this place
review: Super place. Feel proud to be born in this Country. This place depicts the enormous battles fought by our soldiers. Felt the goosebumps on seeing the Artillery (tanks, machine guns, airforce planes) displayed at this place. Must watch the 10 minute video of freedom that these people play for people visiting the Museum.

title: Felt like a proud Indian
review: You may go to this place if you have free time on hand. But you can always skip this as there isn't nothing much to see. I did as I feel really proud about our Military.

title: one of the best museums under the Indian Army
review: Reached there a bit late but the army people were so helpful for us to go through the movie all over again. Just on the entrance of the golden city "Jaisalmer" from Bikaner. you'll find a flag rising high if you want to locate it. just 12 kms from the city.

title: Amazing place, a Must visit place
review: Jaisalmer war museum is a very well maintained beautiful place. Its an excellent war museum, you get to see various tanks/fighter planes used by Indian army / air force during 1971 war with Pakistan. They also show a 20 min movie which has clippings from documentaries on NDA, IMA and some clips from various Bollywood movies. There is also a small shop from where you can buy souvenirs. Overall very good experience, just loved it.

title: jaisalmer war museum
review: amazing place. with all army stuffs like guns, tanks, must visit place in jaisalmer my army lover so m there whole day

title: excellent
review: Must visit place , show it to your children , they will surely love it , try to visit in early morning or late evening in summer

title: Average
review: Visit The museum only if your à big fan of weapons and tank or if you have nothing to do in jaisalmer.

title: Inspirational Place
review: I like this place very much . History of the Indian army and glorious victories by the Indian army explained very nicely .

title: Best  place
review: While returning from jaisalmer we visited this place well maintained neat and clean. Show was also good and interesting. And one mam describe  about  all the thing there.

title: A must visit sightseeing spot
review: Started recently 2 years back. It is a must visit sightseeing spot just 12kms before Jaisalmer. Open from 10am to 6pm. It depicts the valour with which our Defense forces fought the Longewala Battle against Pakistan. A short 15min video is shown every half an hour.

title: Dauntingly beautiful and awe inspiring
review: This place is on the way to Jaisalmer city (about 40 kms before), so be on a lookout for it, f you're driving down. It is so awe inspiring and humbling. There are various weaponry and confiscated enemy tanks from the Indo Pak war. There is also timeline depiction of Indian wars and war heroes in Rajasthan. There is also a short film they show on the Indo Pak war. It's a must visit attraction.

title: One of the best war museums in the country
review: Jaisalmer has witnessed one of the most ferocious battles between India and Pakistan. This place is a war historian's paradise, with extensive coverage of the wars we have fought. A must visit place if you happen to be in Jaisalmer. There is a lot at display, so do spend some time here and know a little bit about your armed forces.

title: Place To Trbute To Army
review: Superb place. about 15-20 kms from Jaisalmer to Ramdevra highway. Located on the highway. It needs 2 hous time to visit. It is the witness of Indo-Pak war. The real Tanks and Arms display is great to feel. 10-15 mins video is also there. You will definitely mesmerize by the great work done by our ind army. keep camera with you to click.

title: Pride, Glory & Patriotism!!
review: Jaisalmer War Museum has a totally different Aura. The is highly secured area and strict security measures are followed here. Carry ID proofs of every person visiting.

title: LOVE TO VISIT AGAIN AND AGAIN... FEEL PROUD
review: Must visit place for all Indians to feel the sacrifices of the real heroes of our motherland... Really awesome experience and feel proud to be there..

title: Don't miss this place
review: If you are an Indian and visiting Jaisalmer....don't miss this place. Allocate around 3 hours for a complete visit. Make sure you see the audio visual treat by the Indian Army. You will leave the place with your head held high and your heart full of pride.

title: Jaisalmer war muesum
review: Jaisalmer war museum is the great place to see valor of our soldier during indo pak war and another british india revolution war ...many historical memory preserved here

title: A Slice Of Indian Military History
review: The Jaiselmer War Museum is a beautifully laid out military museum showcasing the rich martial history of India both pre and post independence with  a large number of rare photographs, displays and military hardware. Truly an awe inspiring place set in the sand dunes of Rajasthan to relieve the glory of the Indian Army.

title: Humbled, respect for the defence personnel
review: It was a humbling experience after seeing the video of the wars fought by the Indian defence forces. The trunks, tanks, and fighter jet add to the respect for the personnel.

title: War Meusiam
review: A place to see the Armed Forces deed of gallantry & valour. Well managed with all amenities. Souvenir shop sells good quality accessories with War Museum logo. A nice place to visit.

title: Experienced proud feelings
review: Small meseum but must visit place near jaisalmer. We feel proud while looking stories and monuments of bravery and sacrifice of our soilders  . Happy to see there picture and note about Chttrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

title: Feeling Proud...Must Visit
review: Jaisalmer War Museum is few km from Jaisalmer city. if you're on self-drive then you can visit this place before heading city. The museum is small but maintained very well. They have 2 huge galleries where they kept all War memories, weapons and info about war.

title: Trip down memory Lane
review: Must visit for Indian History lovers, live ammo and captured battle tanks and guns on display.

title: spacial
review: it is very spacial for me i had lot of information about Indian force.

title: Best Museum I have ever visited
review: Jaisalmer War Museum is really a place to be if you are in Jaisalmer. See the tanks and artillery right from the Longewala post during the 1963 war. The dummies of soldier. One will come to know what our soldiers offer to us. For sure one of the best and must to visit

title: Honourable place for Indian Army
review: I was happy to visit a wonderful. This play displays how our brave soldiers fight in severe conditions. There is a good display of armoury and tanks, including some captured Pakistani ones.We felt proud being There.

title: History
review: Located at the entrance of Jaisalmer city, this place has two attractions - a small movie and a couple of exhibition halls. Fifteen minute movie is a documentary and the museum houses some good artifacts. Good place to visit if you are a history buff. Clean and well maintained place

title: Perfect
review: Perfect place to learn abt the many battles fought and feel proud of our soldiers and our county ... Jai Jawan !

title: Indian army🇳🇪🇳🇪🇳🇪
review: Honoured to be here was a great feeling and a proud moment one of the best place to be I suggest everyone to visit here

title: Revives the memories of scarifies and courage of our Military..
review: very nicely laid out.. from the starting to now..

title: Excellent Place to know about the army
review: it is 13 km from jaisalmer city. you can hire a cab. i paid rs 300 for the ride back to jaisalmer. it takes around one hour to see it. avoid going in the hot sun if summer. there are many indian and pakistani tanks , armour vehicles and radar vehicles which can be seen and touched. a small war movie is shown for rs 50. it is also good. there is a small war merchandise shop where u can buy caps and jackets with war memes printed on it.. overall a must visit place.

title: Must Visit Well Maintained Museum
review: Its on the way to Jaisalmer by road just before Jaisalmer city. Its a must visit place, well maintained. Army shows a short film on war bravery of our soldiers which is really heart touching. Its a tribute to our real heroes our soldiers.

title: Feeling pride to look at our history
review: it is one of the great place to visit if you are interested in war history. all major wars well displayed for understanding the sacrifice done by our beloved soldiers

title: V Good to See for mid aged Child
review: We found it interesting spot and many things were learning for us as well as for the child. Its on the way to Bikaner/Jodhpur.

title: Place to Be
review: Wonderfully developed and restored soviniors from the Indo - Pak War. You can get an idea about the facilities Indian Soldior use to have during 1960s. Must visit

title: it is worth a visit
review: On the road from Bikaner I think it is a worth a visit to see all the wars India has experienced .....It takes only 30 minutes to go through.

title: dedicated to true patriots....
review: A well maintained war museum consisting the history and glory of Indian army, battles and wars fought. A small store shop consisting hand made house decorating items, a video room displaying the glory of wars fought by Indian army against Pakistan; a canteen serving yummy food, rooms for displaying all kinds of weapons, tanks, army uniforms and lots more to learn...

title: History of War
review: War museum  jaisalmer is remember us memory of war fight with pakistan. You see there various type of weapons guns and tank. You also see pakistans tank and vehicles that won by indian army in the war. Easy to reach by road from jaisalmer. It is 6 kilometer away from jaisalmer.

title: Reminder of our Brave soldiers
review: This museum is 7 km away from Jaisalmer. The video shown there was about the Indo-Pak war & the bravery of our soldiers. There are two halls showing various timeless war time photos, some original items recovered from war & tells of our brave-hearts. War machines are also displayed in the museum. A must visit place.

title: A must to see place for all Indians
review: Jaisalmer War museum is by far the best museum I have visited in recent time. The place is so well maintained and organized by the Indian Army. A big salute to the Indian Army for creating and maintaining this amazing place, which is filled with patriotism and stories of sacrifices made by our brave soldiers.

title: Must Visit
review: It is a must-see destination if you are visiting Jaisalmer. One that fills the heart with pride! Very well organized war museum.

title: Longewala War
review: The concept is good, however the short film and display arrangements could have been made more attractive

title: If you want to learn about the Kashmir conflict this is the place to stop just outside Jaisalmer
review: In case you are interested in India`s view of the conflict with Pakistan this is the place to stop for a short visit. There are documentaries and lots of showcases and fotos plus the necessary descriptions of the Indian point of view of the conflict and explaining in detail why India feels that Kashmir should be a part of India rather than Pakistan.

title: Shows the Bravery of India Soldiers.
review: Indian soldiers and India it self is a great. So,if you are interested in defense and desparate to know about the India Pakistan war of 1971 then this is a must visit place.

title: Salute to the spirit of Indian Army
review: This is a very nice museum to see the tanks of Indian Army and the Pak tanks captured during the war. The film shown in the museum is very nice and informative. The sound quality needs to be better for the film.

title: worth visiting
review: the history of the Indian Army is well documented and displayed.

title: Interesting collection
review: This museum has a short video history of the wars with Pakistan and a collection of tanks from both India and pakistan. Also many pictures and uniforms of the past.

title: New place on the way to Jaisalmer and worth a stop
review: This is a relatively new place where the artefacts like broken Tanks, Aircrafts, machine guns etc. are kept for display from India-Pakistan war of 1971.  A nice place to visit and get the war details and the sequence of events during the war period.  Very neatly kept and maintained.  One feel prod as an Indian during visit to this place.

title: bharat mata ki jai
review: war museum situated in army area and very attractive palace. here  we seen many army war equipment which is use in real war.

title: A must visit
review: We were not aware of this place . We juz saw it on the way and stopped by and we are glad that we made that decision. Do watch the movie shown in the theatre.

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: Its a must visit in Jaisalmer city. The museum is very well maintained and is around 15 km from city on Jodhpur road. They organize 15 min short film on Ind-Pak wars and a good collection of tanks. Small canteen is available for refreshments.

title: The most authentic display of warfare and real battlefield weapons
review: its around 12 kms from Jaisalmer on highway towards Jodhpur.. Can be visited enroute on arrival or departures from Jaisalmer to/from Jodhpur..The superb display of real battlefiled weapons like tanks, jeeps, rocket lauchers is mazing. The inside display of other personal weapons and actual objects picked during the war is equally fascinating... Try to see Video show also... Must visit...

title: nice place
review: its war museum and contains lot of photograph and mometos it is a nice place to see the indian military might

title: Feeling of Pride
review: Must visit for all Indians. The A/V is a good source of information about the many wars witnessed by the armies deployed in those regions of the country.

title: Must visit
review: Clean and well maintained, obviously, because it is maintained by the Indian Army. The place tells you stories of Battle of Longewala amongst stories of other battles. There is a picture of a missile saying, "From Raveen Tandon, to Nawaz Sharif" from 1999 Kargil War. You can also find old tanks, anti-tank guns, trucks. You can freely click pictures with them.

title: Jai hind!!!
review: This is best place in jaisalmer. In this we know about Indian army, how our Indian army fought with bravery. Every Indian should take their kids to this place. I feel very proud to an Indian when I reach this place. Jai hind!!!

title: Must Visit Place
review: Actually this museum was situated at Longewala but later it was shifted to its present location. Since this museum is under construction, there is lot more things to add.

title: Worth a visit
review: Helped me to learn more about past history and the current possible threats faced by this brave nation as well as involvement of Indian army in Europe.

title: seems ok o visit
review: the display is good and informative.

title: Informative and emotionally filling
review: Fantastic museum which gives the history of activities, technical developments and achievements of the Indian military over a period of about 1000+ years. Information on great and not exactly well known in India soldiers like Arjun Khetpal is very inspiring. The display of various types of arms, ammunition, armored vehicles and Battle Tanks including a few captured from Pakistani Army was very impressive and informative. The lawns around and the exceptionally good cafeteria at the entrance along with the screenings makes it a must visit in India not just Jaisalmer or Rajasthan

title: Know about the wars and some interesting facts!
review: Jaisalmer War Museum.

title: Excellent - Indian Army War Museum
review: We visited the Jaisalmer War Musem and were pleasantly surprised at the number of artifacts that is kept on display there. It is superb. The 12 min film show is amazing. Plus the memento shop has good souvenirs. The food in the cafe run by an ex-army man is great as well. All in all it is a must see and time well spent.

title: Good museum
review: War museum is the fantastic place to see the weapons and tanks used during the war. All the tanks that were used are present there Big Indian flag is also there and got to know the history of fights and how our forces helped to win.

title: Informative
review: This is in the entrance of Jaisalmer and can be covered quickly. This gives info on the wars that we had in 1900's with our neighboring country. Tanks and other vehicles are for display.

title: good effort by the Indian Army
review: The exhibits are good and portray history of the wars well. This is an emotional place to visit. Spotlessly clean and well maintained

title: must place to visit
review: Amazing place to visit. War memorial+ Amazing food there. A must visit place in winters with friends

title: A museum built using real machinery and defence equipments we are proud of
review: The Audit Visual show (7-8 mins) is a collage of actors speech + movies + news + past recordings and provides good information about the 1971 war.

title: Good place
review: Must visit to understand the history of the forces, They run a short film on the Indo Pakistan war, Tanks and war planes are on display for public to see.

title: Excellent place
review: Hats off to BSF and our defence personnel for managing this place.

title: The feel of Patriotism
review: It's good know about your soldiers and the history behind all the wars. You feel for your soldiers who fought for the country.

title: A place must visit and proud to be indian.
review: A great story of our JAWANS and their history of different wars and victory over enemies.We visited this on 26th January on our Republic day with friends and children.

title: Beautiful halt on the way to Jaisalmer
review: We stopped here on the way to Jaisalmer, coming from Jodhpur. Its just 15 mins before Jaisalmer. As it was the week of 26th Jan, there were some extra tanks and ammunition on display, which was a bonus. This place has a couple of halls which have some basic items on display. Also they play a 15 min video on regular intervals, on bravery tales of Indian army. Overall a good 1 hr halt on the way to Jaisalmer.

title: Excellent place and must see
review: This is a must see place in Jaisalmer. Covers our war history. Very well maintained by the army. Totally worth a visit

title: Very patriotic place. You will feel proud about Indian Army
review: A place which bring lot of emotions for your country when you visit this place. The place has lot of museum on different war which took places like longevala  etc . It has tanks , planes etc on display . a must visit

title: The best
review: It gives a very good knowledge about the army, shop is also very attractive and I feel at least one time visit is necessary

title: Vijay Gatha
review: 1971 war memories come alive. Short movie is very exciting. Well maintained museum by Army. The jawans are very polite and know their job. Must see and spend time. Jai Hind.

title: Decent
review: The place is located 13 km from Jaisalmer.

title: National pride
review: We visited the museum and frankly felt very proud of our army and our battle honours. It is well curated and marked. The displays are interesting and their history clearly explained. This is a must do.

title: MUST Visit
review: Our visit to the War Memorial filled us with pride and one must visit to know about the Indian Army and what it has done for its citizens. Well organised.

title: pride & honor ..
review: best place for all Indians .. history must be recalled.. This is the place on which the Block bluster Film Border has filmed & we must appreciate our soldiers for all their support.

title: Awesome Army
review: Just on the outskirts of Jaisalmer is the War Museum. One of its kind. Free Entry. Very neat and a must visit place.

title: A Nice Memorial dedicated to the heroic soldiers of Longewala Battle
review: Just a little outside jaisalmer city , can be visited while coming or going from jaisalmer , this is a nice museum that has a collection of stories , memorials and tanks that have been used by the army in the wars with pakistan and some confiscated pakistani tanks as well , they have a very informative audio visual , included in the ticket price and a souvenir shop. A well spent and informative hour of sightseeing.

title: Brilliant War Museum
review: This war museum displays various types of armed weapons used by Indian soilder in the Longewala battle against Pakistan.The museum also houses a small cafeteria where you can try delicious and low price foods.

title: Great Experience
review: Visiting the War Museum was a wonderful learning experience. I would recommend this to everyone visiting Jaisalmer. Excellent exhibits, wonderfully organized.

title: Remember the fallen
review: Jaisalmer War Museum is a very recent addition to tourist circuit of Jaisalmer and it's worth a visit 10 out of 10 times especially for Indian tourists. A place where history of all wars Independent India has fought since 1947 is nicely preserved and presented. Reading about the PVC Medal winners fills you with a sense of pride and makes you bow respectfully to the martyrs who have laid down their life (and continue to do so endlessly) for our peaceful life.

title: Salute
review: Salute to the brave Indian army ,you will feel awesome you can see details about indian history and war. it was worth visit place in jaisalmer

title: great place for patriotism
review: enjoyed selfies wit tanks and war stories of our jawans. must visit to understand the history of our wars

title: Must Visit
review: The Museum is well maintained with a minimal entry fee , They will show you a small movie of 20 mins. A must visit place.

title: Museum
review: NIce pictorial depiction of the achievements of our brave soldiers and a few machinery, artilleries, tanks on display.

title: 1971 War.
review: Situated a little away from the city this museum can be visited on the way to or from Jaisalmer, the photography gallery is nice and informative.

title: Goosebumps
review: Very well maintained and informative. must stop here before you must go to longewala post. The tanks the real equipments, the story of the wars our soldiers fought bravely in adverse conditions, the martyrs. Sure to bring out the feeling of patriotism.

title: Just Wow
review: A great place to revive your patriotism. A little far from the Sam Sand Dunes on your way to Longewala post, its just amazing. The tanks the fighter planes and a short film on the heroic achievements of the Indian Army will give you goose bumps

title: Replica of original
review: Good place to feel the patriotism. The short movie is full of excitement .  The shopping is very economical.

title: Worth a visit
review: Enjoyed the visit. AV room is quite small and gets very crowded during peak periods. Otherwise reasonably maintained. A little memorial for brave soldiers who sacrificed their lives for the country.

title: Very Informative
review: Very Informative and well maintained . There's 15 min vedio show and 2 major halls are full of war relics. There's also a canteen which serves moderate snacks

title: Worth a visit
review: They show you a small film about one of the wars that India have fought. They also have some tanks and vehicles captured during the wars from other countries.

title: Must Visit
review: Really amazing museum showing a lot about the indo pak war and others as well, good for both children and adults. It will show you how army operates in different situations, you can hire a guide as well from the reception.

title: Fantastic memorial cememorating the Army
review: Excellent historical depiction of the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971 and the men and equipment which took part in it.

title: Good
review: Must visit and see the film show every 15 min.The tank models/Dresses/Weapons are displayed.Security check is there so,keep ur ID card.Well maitained.Army Guide provide all the information.Rs20/-for film show of war

title: really a beauty
review: nice experience of life we saw war museum and enjoyed a lot spend time with army people salute to them

title: Feeling of patrotism
review: Nice to visit to ignite patriotism within Indians. There are war related items on display and most eye catching are tanks

title: Very Nice Memorial
review: Around 10 km from main city is the War Memorial where the history of Indo-Pak wars is displayed along with the details. There is also an audiovisual film which is very good. It really wakes up the patriotism in everyone.

title: Good Place to Visit
review: Good Place to Visit in case you want to know what your soldiers did for freedom and history of India in wars etc.

title: Co incident visit
review: We were way to desert tulip resort ,and saw the was meuseum board.ee halted there.20 rs,/ persn can click photographs.a patriotic feel geared up.at  the entry of main gate two quotes on two milestone forced to captured pic.cafetaria is there.a short film of army we missed as it was closing time

title: for the patriotic feeling
review: beautifully maintained

title: Must visit it
review: A MUST visit for anyone who is travelling to jaisalmer. Its very well maintained and a very nice place

title: Can Visit if you pass are passing through
review: It's a recently built museum dedicated to the Armed Forces. 10-12 km from the city, an auto takes 400-500 for a roundtrip. A nicely built museum showing the history of the indian armed forces and the 5 major wars where India took part in.

title: Ok Types
review: If you have spare time in jaisalmer you can go and visit. I didnt find anything great in this. they can make it much more better. i value the spirit of our army. i am just saying that it can be better.

title: Well maintained
review: A good place to know the heroics of Indian soldiers. Inspiring for young kids to look in the life of soldiers and taste the real machines used in war long time back.

title: best place to visit
review: we have visited this place with my group . good place to see we enjoyed the time which we have spend with army people

title: Worth visiting
review: If you want to view the grandeur of Indian Army must visit place. You can see the real tanks and weapons used by our soldiers

title: A place to feel proud of our nation and pay tribute to the bravest warriors
review: The place provides complete details and history of India's Defense against the foreign attacks and our military organization since world war 1.

title: A must visit
review: We just happened to visit ( were driving to Jodhpur).

title: Army Museum
review: I have seen many museum but this museum is unique. It is dedicated to Indian Army. This place is around 18-20 kilometers from Jaisalmer Railway Station. Entry is free but there is a nominal fee to watch video dedicated to Indian Army. Photography is also free.

title: A must to see
review: entering jaisalmer you can see this.a must see one. my kids simply loved it. we were very proud to see the people who have fought for us and the words they have said 'epic'

title: Worth visiting this place
review: It's on Jaisalmer - Pokhran road. No entry fees. You can see tanks trucks which were captured during INdo Pak War of Longewala. Also it does have other stories in pictorial format and overview of Indian soldiers life.

title: A proud museum
review: A must visit place for everyone, all about Indian army struggles, fight, dedication and short movie about Longwala war. very well organized with shopping store, canteen and washrooms, a store provides t-shirts and caps of Indian army and many more Patriotic stuff, various cannon and guns from Pakistan which we won in war also displayed, a strong feeling about Indian army and you will feel proud saluting our flag, In entrance you will get various Inspiring captions find of your choice and click, very good place for Army lover or I should say every Indian.

title: feel the pride when you enter
review: the museum has their own guides who will explain the battles and the role of war heroes well. they also show a short film on the indo pak war which fills you with pride. there are exhibits from the Longewala war. A must visit if you are an Indian Army fan like me

title: One of the higest rated WAr Museum
review: Heard some exciting stories about the 1971 war. Amazing. Their belief that the bombs did not blast because of god faith.

title: I am humble to our Indian army
review: Very good video presentation. Shopped very nice items. Very huge place with captured tankers. Good saying in the front office. Felt proud.

title: Excellent Museum by BSF
review: A very well maintained place by security personal, you could see the all type of Tank/Fighter Planes/ Arms being used by our security personal. A few of the Pakistani captured tank is also on display.

title: Free attraction
review: It's worth the stop if you have an interest in the subject matter, have the time to stop by and/or it happens to be on your way. If none of the above are true it's probably worth a skip unless you are desperate for something free to do.  Colorful displays in English, along with life size replicas and real tanks/planes etc.

title: A must visit place
