review: You will feel really proud once you visit this museum, always hire a Guide there , they narrate the things so well that you have all together different feeling :) about your Country , Army !

title: Feel proud to be indian
review: Every traveller should visit this place. It tells about succeed of indian army on all wars. Me and my friend both feel proud to be indian.

title: A good to go place on the way to Jaisalmer
review: A good place to visit as it is on the way to Jaisalmer. One can spear approx half and hour to hour here. Well organised as with the booking you can watch a video session and a guide takes you through all the important things in the museum like Tanks of India and Pakistan, Army dress, weapons. A good and open space for you to click pics with Tanks.

title: Well maintained museum
review: It gives a patriotic feeling to be there. The entire history of war of Rajasthan is there. Spend some time to see the museum and know our history. watch a 20 min video they show on wars. Must visit

title: A matter of pride
review: While travelling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur after about 3/4 km we came across a sight by the name Jaislmer war museum, on the left side of the road. The driver was about to ignore this and move ahead. but we made him stop there. And it was an experience which made us proud of our armed forces. Here they have maintained the memories of 1965 and 1971 wars with Pakistan. They have kept the paton tanks captured from enemy country, they have displayed the memories of the Badmer and Longowal battles here. How bravely our forces fought and defeated the enemy is worth showing the next generation, who are perhaps not aware of sacrifices/capability of Indian army.

title: Must visit place
review: Very nice place, It is showing the history of all wars. It is just 10 KM far from jaisalmer on Jodhpur-Jaisalmer Highway.  A must visit place.

title: Tribute to the Indian Army.
review: We didn't even know the existence of such a museum, but while we were driving towards Jaisalmer, happened to notice this place and we stopped out of sheer curiosity.

title: Jai hind ki sena !
review: Feels patriotic when you come to see the act of valour and sacrifice our soldiers do to keep us safe ! Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer!

title: India s recent war history.
review: A good overview of India s war history, especially conflicts with Pakistan and China. Lots of photos and military artifacts of war. Outside it has a series of tanks and cannons captures in the different conflicts.

title: Excellent Army Museum at Jaisalmer
review: This war memorial is an excellent museum and worth visiting. The nominal fee and the personalized guide who are the dependents of the army staff were excellent and deserve all the praise.

title: Impressive collection of tanks
review: Stopped here briefly to look at the tanks, and 2 rooms with information mainly about the long running Indo-Pak war, from the Indian perspective.

title: Well maintained...visit on your way to jaisalmer.
review: The Museum is roughly 15 kms (15 mins) drive from Jaisalmer on the way to Jodhpur. It’s well maintained museum. They have 10 mins film on Indian Army/ past wars (charges Rs.25) and a                                                                   souvenir shop. It will take around 45-60 mins to thoroughly see this place.Photography allowed (no charges).

title: Goosebumps !!!
review: Really interesting place to visit. Started on Aug 2015.

title: Just about OK
review: This was an ordinary museum probably because im comparing it to US standards, since i lived there for a decade.

title: patriotic feeling
review: love for your country feeling awaken this little away from city. Feel so connected with our Indian army as this place our soldiers made acheivement. Small cafe there is best place to dine/have lunch/snacks i found in Jaisalmer. one feel y to go for war museum if u love ur country to pay tribute to martyrs and raise the morale of our Army men must visit

title: Brings alive the Indian in you
review: Good coverage of history, covering all our triumphs over Pakistan, Its clean and maintained very well. Its a must visit for every Indian and a must see the video documentary when you are there.

title: Proud to have been there
review: A war museum dedicated to our Indian Army. Well maintained. After seeing the film , the pictures , exhibits and touching our Weapons, Tanks and Fighter plane , as well as the captured Paki weapons , tank and truck on static display there , one feels sheer pride and honour ,  that we have such a professional Army guarding us day and night.

title: Jai Hind
review: No words to describe the feelings there. Audio-visual programme is very informational. Most difficult, respected job to deal with. Very well maintained.

title: Small and powerful
review: Its a small museum but its good. If you have few hours in spair then its better to visit it as it refreshes the patrotic sides of you. Video show that is about all India great war and tanks (and other vehicles) taken from other countries are something to look forward too.

title: Good Place
review: Its worth seeing. It is on the Jaisalmer Jodhpur road ...Just before the jaisalmer Town. There is Visual show Must see that

title: Salute to hero's
review: Must visit before any other attractions in Jaisalmer,  the museum also has a audio video room do watch and listen of what our army is capable of and have accomplished.  My chest was  full of more pride and respect for our  soldiers and country.  For keeping us safe.

title: True Indian Feeling...:)
review: Visited this place in November Nice place with lot of information of the various war and photos depicting the war time.

title: Great tribute to the brave jawans
review: The war museum is a must visit place on your trip to Jaisalmer. Fabulous collection of weapons, chronicles of wars and tributes to the brave men who keep our nation safe. A salute to the people who made this possible.

title: One derives great sense of pride!
review: This was visited at close of my visit of Jaipur. I had to board train from Rly Station and had about two hours on hand, so requested taxi driver to take me to this place, where I felt like a true patriot! This place has histories of most of the battles, India has fought so far, with a specific focus on our neighbour Pakistan. A good number of Tanks, guns and fighter jets are on display here. It is a must see for any patriot in India!

title: good one to visit
review: movie was good , single place to know war history and war industry.

title: Must Visit for every Indian
review: One of the most patriotic places I have ever visited. Talks about from the evolution of Army in India to recent sino-India & India-Pak wars and their Heroes. Every true Indian will be overwhelmed by the sacrifices of our brave soldiers and appreciate the true cost of our freedom which most of us take for granted.

title: Feel the pride
review: Relive the India Pak war with captured enemy tanks and weapons. With scenes from Indo-China war, with pictures and information about our real war heroes and strategists, feel proud of yourself being an Indian and alongside remember our soldiers who were martyred in the battles.

title: PRIDE OF INDIA
review: I feeled very proud and very excited , If U are in Jaisalmer & as indian U do not visit here ????? 10 km away. We were 5 , took Auto Rickshaw

title: Do visit
review: It is about 16 km on jodhpur road. A replica of longewala museum which is 122 km away. Details of past wars and gallantry awards are documented here. Do visit. Will take you an hour to go through.  There is also a 10 minutes video on the longewal battle. And one gets to see the tanks and trucks used by Pakistan in the war against India. One can also buy t-shirts of Indian army here. There is a cafeteria for lunch and snacks.

title: Very well maintained government museum. A real ode to the bravery of our jawans.
review: Very nice and refreshing experience. While entering a government museum, on comes to expect drab bureaucratic behavior.  Pleasantly surprised to find methodically arranged and spotlessly maintained exhibits.

title: A must visit
review: War museum at Jaisalmer is very well done with ample details about wars with Pakistan, which were fought in that area too. Specific wins from 1965, 1971 and Kargil war are well depicted. There are quite a few war machines, which played a role in these wars. It does include some vehicles abandoned by Pakistan during the war and captured by Indian Army.

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: Do visit this place, this place shows our battle history. Do watch the small movie that they are showing, which shows how our real heroes fought bravely in wars. Try to visit in morning hours, as whole area is in open ground.

title: Being from Iindian Navy this spot has 1971 remembered
review: Fair collection of memories of 1971 equipment. Being from Indian Navy such a collection did interest me. Hope the well maintained and sprawling area remains well maintained.

title: jaisalmer Musu
review: This is on the highway from Jodhpur to JAISALMER.A must place to seeVery inspiring to know what our jawans ahave done for our to retain our freedom. The flag flying in sky is not because ofwind but because of the security provided by our army.

title: salute to my indian army
review: my husband wanted to take a ride out of hotel and we landed up here. we were so glad with this new place to add to our itinerary. awesome reatro inside. spacious parking. many amunitions and planes and other war scrap is beautifully displayed here. a small movie running frequently tells us about sacrifices made by our national heroes. i was very impressed with this museum.

title: Proude on our army
review: This is place where you will see tanks plane gun with touch. N feel proud on our army. Entry is free.  Audio visual room entry is 25 rs.

title: Tribuite to our Heroes
review: Fantastic place. Felt Proud to be an Indian after visiting the place. a true tribute to our war heroes.

title: A must visit War Museum!
review: A well thought and maintained War Museum managed by BSF (Indian Army).

title: Jaisalmer War Museum
review: Jaisalmer War Museum situated near Jaisalmer Jodhpur Highway, Jaisalmer also a very popular sightseeing sport and famous for foreign tourist.

title: A deserving salute to our brave ARMED FORCES
review: A MUST-VISIT destination for EVERY Indian!

title: Captivating site
review: A must stop for all tourists just before entering Jaisalmer city. A knowledgeable and captivating site .

title: The War Museaum
review: On the very first sight of this museum, u started feeling love for your country, the inspiring quotes written on milestones, old Indian tanks, enemy tanks the national flag gives you goosebump.In the museum, there are the various statute and written history on the wall of all the wars taken place, then after they showed us a short movie on Indian freedom struggle and war.We purchased Indian army cap and t-shirt from there.

title: Good colections
review: Must visit place. ... good collection of tanks and artillery... The war video is also inspiring.... Hat's off to our soldiers

title: Good museum with lot of information and good collection.
review: There is tight security to enter this place. Though looks huge, can be covered in an hours time. Lot of facts and figures. Quite a few open displays of tankers and trucks and aircrafts. There is even an visual of a 20 minute video. Respect to the Indian Army.

title: Truly Inspiring place
review: A must-visit place if you are touring Jaisalmer. A place where history comes alive. Should not take more than an hour and a half

title: Good attempt. Does not evoke patriotism.Too overcrowded. No attempt to mange the crowds
review: A collection of stories from Various battles. Some Articles of War. The exhibition is simple.Does not evoke awe.

title: Just flying visit
review: good to understand the war zone & India's  battle history. a movie show feel proud myself that I just born in this brave country.

title: Jai Jawan.. Feel the Pride of INDIA..
review: Its a must visit place when in Jaisalmer.. Its on the highway Jodhpur - Jaisalmer Road.. 9 Kms from Jaisalmer.. They have beautifully presented the war scenes and the Guide (which bdw they have kept has to be compulsory Army Man's wife) was very informative.. There is a 15 min short film also which was not hearable because of poor sound speakers.. Rest everything is amazing.. They also have a Warrior Cafe - run by again an Ex-Army Officer.. The cafe served good Chole.. The entire museum should not take more than 75 mins of yours.. Worth the visit..

title: Awesome place... nice feel of battle history
review: Must visit place, U get to know stories about various battles. Has Tanks, aircrafts on show. Kids might find it really interesting

title: Do Not Miss....
review: Its on the way to Jaisalmer around 15kms. There is lots of information presented in this musuem like names and some statues of shahid jawans, tanks, aircrafts. 1971 Kargil war story was very well explained by one of the employees over there. Hats off to Indian Military... We are here because of you..

title: Memorial of India's courage
review: The army war museum is situated about 6 kms from Jaisalmer on the highway to Pokharan. It opens at 9:30 am.  It has a collection of weapons used in wars from small A-K 47 to large hand missile launchers. It also has many kinds of suits used in wars like mountain suit and chemical suit for Indian Army. It has a large section for tanks of India and tanks stolen by INDIA from Pakistan. There is also a fighter plane of Pakistan .The museum also shows a 12 mins film of the war between INDIA and Pakistan. Tourist must visit this spot

title: Must See
review: Perfect place to watch and feel proud for our soilders and our country. Its on the way to Jaisemer from Jodhpur. Dont miss it

title: Must Visit Place when entering Jaisalmer
review: The JWM showcases the best of Indian Army's exploits, immortal brave souls who have sacrificed their lives to save ours and is a great place to educate ourselves and our kids and bring back memories of our glorious past and promises of a brighter future.

title: feeling patriotism
review: Nice place,Controlled by BSF , It shows army weapons ,tanks,their is three senctions which is having great knowledge.

title: Majestic
review: Excellent place to visit especially for kids. They will love to see the army vehicles and the little stories written about them.

title: "Jai Hind" from the Heart :-)
review: A must 2/3 hours visit while in the city. Being the border city, one is naturally thrilled to experience the chivalry possessed by the Indian Army and their feats in the 1971 battle of the Longewala. Wives of serving army officers double up as paid guided and the way they take one around the entire campus is so encouraging in itself. The depiction and weaponry is exhibited from East Indian Company to the Kargil War and enriches oneself with more knowledge about the bravery, discipline and sacrifices of the armed forces.

title: Excellent WAR MUSEUM
review: This place is very good for war history lover specifically for INDIAN MILITARY. In this museum learn how to our military  do they job in caviar conditions. Please visit here so many artillery restored for our knowledge. Please visit

title: Must visit place
review: A must see for every people who loves his country...Jai Hind...great place to see....one should not miss this place.Has a good canteen and a souvenir shop.

title: Awesome
review: Get the feeling of patriotism in you. History of the wars the great Indian Army has fought.Pictorial display in full glory. A good eating joint in the campus.

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: On almost front line of defense this is a must visit place  in Jaisalmer. There is detailed description of every war fought by this regiment and for a patriot it is an emotional experience that can never be forgotten. Just few kms from the town it is easy to reach and must visit for family to know how difficult it is to protect our great country in desert land.

title: Simply Patriotic
review: The place is very well maintained and very informative about the history of the wars which Indian Army has fought over the years. Simply Patriotic and a must visit place.

title: Must to Visit
review: One should not miss this war museum, one of the best place to know more about Indian Army bravery and achievements..

title: so nice place nd palace
review: nice place and palace to good journey

title: Good way to make a civilian realize the achievements and sacrifices done by our forces for us
review: Its a must visit in Jaislamer. They have 2 halls explaining about the different wars our country have fought with the heros of those wars.

title: Vande Mataram...
review: Gives you a piece of  history and makes you realise the sacrifices made by our Army... the places is managed by the Army jawans and is a must visit.

title: Underwhelming
review: It's essentially a chest-thumping, story-telling session of the glories of the Indian army. Except that the story telling is in Hindi. They have a film reel which is not the best put together documentary. I did, however, notice a surge of patriotic fervour amongst the rest of the visitors there. Maybe they understood something that I didn't.

title: Proud India
review: This museum is on route and one should drop in and review India's military might. The Indo Pakestan war is fully explained. There are many displays and the collection of military muscle is large.

title: Indian war museum
review: true love for the country is only showed by the army..they have displayed the captured pakistani tanks.some guns...armoury used by indian soldiers details of the war fought..and how soldiers stay at sicken ..a must visit for all true Indians.

title: great place
review: a very good patriotic place to visit but i was expecting more. they only have things related WW1 and 2.

title: Brought a tear to the eye of local visitors....
review: But the lack of a balanced view of India's post independence wars was a bit alarming in this day and age...

title: Respect :)
review: Right from the beginning to the end I've enjoyed the visit to this museum. It begins with a short documentary of the Jaisalmer war and the museum has the war crafts and other suits of armor at display for the visitors. The museum is not one of the boring types and visitors of all age groups can enjoy it. Brownie points as the museum is an open one. Please do visit on your way to the sand dunes . Worth your time and trust me even kids will enjoy this place.

title: excellent collection
review: overall a pleasant to see the war momento . its really a wonderful place to educate ourselves . must go there ....

title: Must watch place for an Indian
review: I was here in last month when I came here with my friends I was not knowing about this place earlier but on the road when we pass we saw something the Indian flag and war Museum was there some people were there around it is just started 2 months before but it has the tanks and planes of Pakistan. After coming here we feels that our Indian Army is doing something great that they are saving our life by capturing the arms and animations of the enemy enemy country we proud.

title: Very interesting
review: This museum gives an interesting perspcetive to the Indo-Pak wars.  Worth a quick visit even if you're not interested in the military exhibits.

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: Wonderful Museum. An opportunity to closely  witness the valor of Indian Army. I was amazed to learn, during 60's Indian soldier transcend from one post to another post by bicycle. Great creation. A must visit place.

title: Patriotism!!!
review: Excellent setup... Could have better story telling! Given the indo-pak fervour I was expecting a lot more 'josh' there! Nevertheless loved the setup there and the details.

title: jai hind
review: this is the place where u feel true patriotism all the tanks and artillery are related to indo pak wars it is see our country winning shots

title: Respect the Army.
review: A great place to get info regarding the Indo Pak wars and about the bravery of our Indian Army...

title: Not to miss
review: Applause for the army for both the thought and execution of a great musuem as a tribute to the sacrifice of our armed forces.  I think the highlight is the arms, ammunition from all the wars that the Indian forces contributed to including WW1&2 and the captured Pakistani tanks from the 71 war

title: Must visit Place
review: We visited this place on the way back to Jodhpur.Excellent museum showing all tge war stories.Different kind of animations/vehicles used for the war are displayed.Vehicles brought from Pakistan which we won in 1971 war are@also displayed.Just visit this place to salute our armed forces & Martyers.Must Visit Place.Jai Hind.

title: Interesting if you're Indian or have small children
review: Not overly interesting if you're not Indian. The value really comes from a feeling of national pride which I'm sure Indians feel when attending at this monument to the Indian Pakistan War. A number of tanks add interest for small children but really not worth more than a ten minute visit, if that for foreign tourists.

title: Entry point of Jaisalmer
review: This is the first attraction when you enter Jaisalmer from Jodhpur. Very near to Airforce quarters. There is nothing great in this meuseum, just a normal one.

title: Superb..
review: Must visit place in jaisalmer. U need around 2 hrs max for the visit. Thrs a small movie on indo-pak wars.  Thrs a nice cafeteria, which serves awsm food

title: Amazing
review: Its very nice place in jaisalmer for visiting .there is lot of things to see .so many tank for there india Pakistan  war. Its very interesting  this place

title: A must visit for war history buffs!
review: A place that's for sure not one to be missed, this museum houses various artifacts which might interest the history buff in you!

title: Bharat Mata ki Jai..
review: That's the feeling we feel when we are at a historical point where our military has fought a remarkable battle..it's 15km away from the indo-pak border. It has the captured tanks from Pak as well as few of our war vehicles. There is an auditorium where a 15min video is shown which we missed it as we were running out of time.

title: Superb
review: It's very nice place .There we saw 15 minutes  movie  India Pakistan war.its so nice. There  is lot of  things  to see  .its free of charge. This musium  is totally  different other  place.

title: Benefits of Road Trip
review: We didn't knew about this when we were on our way to Sam Dunes. Noticed it before entering Jaisalmer, while coming from Jodhpur.

title: Patriotism at its peak at the museum
review: A visit to the war museum instantly makes you feel patriotic and fills you with gratitude for the Indian Military. It houses relics from the war of Lougewala and a rich heritage of the Indian Army in a mesmerising gallery. It's a must visit in your trip to Jaisalmer.

title: Informative! Must visit.
review: The War Museum is about 10kms from the main city. You can hire bikes in Jaisalmer. The museum has all the memories of wars those Indian Army fought. One should visit the museum to understand the conditions in which the army fights.

title: patriotic
review: although a slightly away from jaisalmer, this is one of the places you must visit if you love indian army or if you are fascinated by the war stories . you will see the tanks captured from the enemy by the indian army and dont forget to watch the move

title: One of a kind museum
review: It is a must visit museum where you can see the history of various units in the army and the wars that have taken place in this area. There is also an audio visual presentation before the museum tour which is okay and a cafe to have some coffee and sandwiches and relax.

title: Salute to Soldiers
review: Visited at Afternoon, Sunny Day. Beautifully maintained museum. We had best food in museum canteen, when we stayed in Jaisalmer.

title: hats off to Indian army always
review: its just on the way to jaisalmer and good to see . form the town its only 16km far . its good to visit

title: Must visit
review: You should visit this.  here you can see some moments of Kargil , Indo-Pak war, some exceptional photographs and of course instruments too. Also, now they have started showing the latest equipments used by Indian army and we Indians must feel proud of that! And show our gratitude.

title: Average
review: I thought the 4.5 trip advisor review meant it was a good museum. It really wasn't. The museum has some tanks from the 1960s and tells you about a few conflicts India has had with Pakistan and China. I love my history, but this is more jingoism designed for Indian tourists. If you are a westerner, I wouldn't go out of your way for this place.

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: It is located on jodhpur jaisalmer highway.Went at 11 am.Just enter and there is a register in which you have to enter detail and show i card .Then you have to purvhase ticket of 25rs each.The  there is a film of 12 minutes which shows tales of bravery of our army in wars.Then there are 2 large hall displaying the various epic pictures of war hero's. Also there are displayed pakistani captured tanks.After watching all these there is gush of blood in veins and you end up saying Jai Hind in respect of our soldiers.

title: Uniquely satisfying
review: Generally neglected by most tourists, since its a bit far from the prime show of the city, this has everything apt to its name. Good collection of seized weapons and our own artillery. The short movie they show about how our neighbor was humiliated repeatedly, especially in Longewala is really informative and inspiring. Adding further insult to their injuries, they have kept all Indian tanks saluting the sky, and the Pakistani's kissing the ground :), although I think its more of a military tradition. There's also a nice small shop for collecting memorabilia's of all sorts, dedicated to the vigor of Indian Army .

title: This museum will give you goosebumps :)
review: It is a well built museum and they show a 12 min movie and in case you are lucky and there is less crowd then they will show you two :)

title: proud war memories
review: Its a free entry army museum. Maintained very well. looking at war used weapons, stories of martyrs and wars you definitely feel proud of our soldiers. Its a must go.

title: It will surely touch your heart
review: One of the best place to visit while in Jaisalmer. About 13 km away form the city on the way to Jodhpur highway.

title: A must visit place for patriots
review: This place is located a few kilometres outside Jaisalmer on the Pokran - Jaisalmer road.

title: Salute to Indian army
review: On way back from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur, one must stop at this place. I suggest strongly that you keep a guide who will explain you entire history of Indian army and its victories...!

title: Nice war history museum
review: Nice place to visit with your family if you are in Jaisalmer. Beautiful open air museum maintained by Indian Army. Makes you feel proud.

title: Excellent !!!!!
review: It was a pride to us to visit the War Museum at Jaisalmer which is situated on the main road from Jodhpur to Jaisalmer just before the city. Museum is well built information centre about the security system of the country. One must watch the movie show of short duration in the premises.

title: In Honor of our Soldiers
review: Beautifully maintained war museum that has actually tanks, artillery, fighter aircraft, etc. on display. It is maintained by the Indian Army and entry is free for all. There are two enclosures which have detailed information about the Indo Pak war and chronicles of the victories in battle of the Indian army. A must visit place especially if travelling with kids and they will love the displays of machines and guns :) All in all a very inspirational place which fills your heart with national pride and patriotism. Kudos to the Indian army for creating this war museum.

title: Proud to be an Indian
review: Well, words will always be less for this place. A great place to fill yourself with the patriotism and love for the country

title: Nice place to Visit
review: This war museum is recently open for the public. It is very nice place to see the journey of Indian Army from the time of independance to till ...

title: Good place to visit
review: You love Indian army and interested to know history of Indian army then you will love this place.

title: patriotic feeling
review: amazing place to go where all the arms, fighter jets ,military trucks of the time of the indo pak war are kept.

title: Absolute must visit
review: I am so glad that I visited the Jaisalmer War Museum. The hotel recommended this place. It is 10 kms away from the main city but an absolute must visit. The Museum is spread over a large ground. The ground has war planes and battle tanks they wearer actually used in wars. There are numerous other artefacts and information about all the previous Indian battles and the brave soldiers who laid their lives for the country. Please take time to go through them.

title: place for brave people.
review: thsi is very nice museum.i love this place.this show as how brave our solders are who scarifies there life of our country.

title: Nice museum
review: Good memories display of brilliant Indian military operations in various wars and war heroes. Display of tanks , airplane, huge India flag. Information on various wars and heroes of each war.

title: interesting concept
review: A very good place to learn about shaheeds & jawans of our country...and what happen in kargil war with many more details runs  a very  good movie to get educated about the past

title: Nice museum
review: It's a very nice museum with lots if tanks and airplanes in display. A short 10 min film based on war is shown.

title: Museum of Heroism
review: Well organized. Good public relations. Well maintained. Wish every big city has one such museum. Some more pieces of war arm ours could be added.

title: great museum in jaisalmer
review: when i was went to trip on jaisalmer i saw many historical palace where but the most of  that meseum where oldest goods of maharjas collectting n safely placed where i saw it

title: Proud to be an Indian
review: We were delighted to be among the first few to visit this museum. Our Jaisalmer trip coincided with the opening of this fine memorium.

title: a must visit to know your army  and it's valour n sacrifice
review: the jaialmer war museum is on jodhpur jaisalmer road  some  20 km  short of jaisalmer. it is a pandora of knowledge to learn the sacrificies of indian army and the wars fought to safe guard the nation . the equipment put on display gives you insight into the war fighting capability of our defence forces. being an indian it is a must one ought to  know and pay respect to those who have ensured good night sleeps for all of us. if you miss food n drink you will get it again , but if you miss this you are missing your own history and pride. the museum is maintained b y the army and they charge a nominal fee of 25/-. last but not least , no foreigner misses a visit to this museum if he is in jaisalmer.

title: THE PLACE WHERE ONE SHOULD FEEL PROUD TO BE AN INDIAN
review: visited the museum on 02.01.2016 while on our way back to bikaner. the museum newaly built is a real tribute to our soldiers.One could know all the brief description of wars fought by Indian Army.

title: Gr8!!!
review: This war museum is located around 15 km from Jaisalmer. We can see the captured Pakistani tanks of 1971 war here. There is a movie show which we can see.. Provides good insight of Army and the sacrifices they undertake to make our life pleasant.

title: Great patriotic experience
review: I traveled this museum while heading jaisalmer from Jodhpur and it's right on NH15 highway so easy to access. You can witness bravery of prideful army and their dedicated service towards nation. Few gunned downed Pak army tanks and vehicles cheers the spirit!!! :-)

title: Very interesting, well laid out new museum
review: Situated about 10 kms outside the city amongst the military bases, this is a new facility that is well laid out and very informative.  Focusses mainly on the post -Independence period, it has a good audio-visual introduction, a couple of large display rooms and a wide range of tanks and vehicles.

title: Patriotic and as expected, a little biased
review: The displays here are well spread out around a vast grassed area with fountains and waterfalls I felt were somewhat optimistic in a desert environment. The day I visited the waterways were inhabited only by algae and frogs; note to Indian Army, empty ponds and inoperative water features are kind of sad and forlorn.

title: Don't miss it
review: Not sure, why this is not projected as a major tourist attraction, frankly speaking, you can easily spend hours at this place not only coming to know all about the history of Indian Army but also it has on display the tanks and other arms captured in war .

title: Well maintained
review: Very well maintained war museum. It got at least 4 information rooms which provide details of Indian army participation in various wars from WW-1 to recent Kargil engagements.

title: A must for every Indian
review: A fantastic beginning, this is a must for every Indian to understand at least a little of the sacrifices, and the glory of the Indian Armed Forces. Please make sure you carry money to buy mementos available only here.

title: Visit to Museum
review: We stopped at the Museum for around an hour while returning from Jaisalmer. This is a good place to stop by and have a look at the army things. They also run a small movie for which you have the buy tickets but for that you have to wait longer. There is a small cafeteria that serves thali (veg and non-veg) along with pizza, pasta and other snacks. Both veg thali and pizza are good. You should definitely stop by if you have time.

title: Well laid out
review: Located on Jodhpur-Jaisalmer highway – 10km before Jaisalmer.

title: War Museum
review: Fantastic no words to explain. I will recommend everybody to visit this place to visit this place to pray for brave soldiers. Jai Hind

title: Must see
review: Museum:-

title: A Journey to the History of Defense
review: This museum fills you with patriotism. This is maintained by the defense forces and the aura of this museum is just wow!!!.

title: Must visit on the trip to Jaisalmer.
review: The place has been created to give a glimpse of the role and feats of the army and its officers. Please take the official guide from the reception.

title: Excellent spot
review: A place good to see and roll yourself for few hours after chilling hot in weather in jaisalmer. But it been nice to catch this place through our taxi we enjoyed our time here.

title: Brave Hearts
review: Our National heroes and their heroics of the longewala fight in 1972 and captured and well protected. MUst visit

title: Tribute to Indian Army heroes.
review: This museum is on the way to Jaisalmer on Jaisalmer Jodhpur Highway. Well maintained and very clean as you expect in Indian Army. Kids will love this place as they get very close on Tanks, Armoured vehicles, Guns, and War mementos. Gives you a patriotic feeling and touches your heart.

title: Wow!!!
review: Every Indian Must Visit this place ... You feel like why am not working for army . People feel like yes we allow our family member are kids to be in army..

title: beautiful place
review: must visit museum. right on the main road, superbly maintained, clean washrooms. and a brief but nice glimpse into 1965 and 1971 war. soviet and american tanks on display in addition to British jet and other defence equipment, also a brief movie about the indo-pak war 1971 can be seen here.

title: Moving !
review: Every Indian should feel proud over war victories of Indian armies . I thoroughly enjoyed going up and down the old tanks of Indian army and taking pictures for my facebook friends.

title: Excellent
review: This is an excellent museum maintained by Indian Army with many mementos of 1971 war. You can even click photographs with the Tanks and fighter planes displayed.

title: A must visit
review: You should visit the War Museum on Jodhpur- Jaisalmer Road. Well maintained and very informative about the Indo-Pak War of 1971. The short documentary film is a must see. Flattered by the conduct of the Army Men stationed there - they take good care of the visitors. Also an experience for those who normally don't get to interact with our Defense Personnel.

title: Must visit, if you love India..
review: A must visit place if you have kids. If u are coming from Jodhpur by road (via pokhran),u will find this place on the way(10 kms away from Jaisalmer). All the kids of my family enjoyed and showed a lot of curiosity. There was a wall on which kids can paste papers after writing something about the Indian Army. They also showed a 15 min mini movie about the Indian wars and army. There was one cafeteria which served good food. There is one souvenier shop which had key chains,T-SHIRT, etc. Overall a must visit place if u are accompanied by kids.

title: Must visit especially for Indians
review: This is a well maintained and organized place. You can see all the military weapons used by Indian army. You can see many artifacts used during 1971 was with Pak.

title: Very Interesting
review: A look back at the war between India and Pakistan.  Very interesting and a great place to visit during your stay in Jaisalmer

title: Stop and reflect back on our war heroes
review: In the middle of the desert, the war museum exhibits tanks and weaponry used in the Indo-Pak war of 1965 and 1971. The camp galleries take you through the entire historical scenario and there are army men to explain many details and tell you about many unheard stories.

title: Worth Viewing
review: Best Place to see our Indian Army and Air Force Gallantry. It was great to watch our Army capturing the Tanks and also our Air force

title: Stupendous ! One to cherish.
review: It's not huge by any means but is a complete journey. There isn't one like this anywhere else in India which makes this place a must visit even if you're in jaisalamer for a day or two. Looking forward to more additions in the future. :)

title: Memerizing Place
review: Must visit and you would find it just before Jaisalmer if you go by Road. You will find information about the army from British era to the last war with Pakistan. Some of the captured tanks are also on display. Salute to Indian Army.

title: Pride of India, the Indian army
review: On the way to Jaisalmer city, a must visit for patriotic indians. Many tanks and war vehicles with souvenirs.

title: A history remembered
review: A place where you will feel the Height of bravery. it is a brush with memories of victory with Pakistan 1965 & 1971. Must visit.

title: Back to Patriotism
review: We planned a visit to this museum as part of Longewala  + Tanot Mata itinerary since the latter only takes 1/2 day. It was a good experience especially with two young kids ( 6 and 8yrs) whose exposure to wars is limited. A video shown by the museum is quite informative and makes us reflect on the lives of soldiers on the border who are there to protect us. There are guides available. We hired one however you may avoid as they are more or less reading what's already written there. However, a must visit.

title: Good place
review: Its a good place to watch. Well maintained lawn and building. Our kids really enjoyed here with tanks and guns.

title: Inspiring!!
review: The war museum evokes respect for the soldiers who lay their lives for the country and suffers casualty for the safety of our lives. The film show and the sale outlet were good.

title: Indian Army - Pride of India
review: Indian Army - Pride of India ....so apt. A relatively new place but an absolute must visit. Do pick up a souvenir from the memorabilia shop. Haven't come across any other place where you can buy something with the Indian Army Logo - which is invaluable.

title: Must Visit
review: Must visit place. History of different battles. You can feel/ride the tanks used in battle. The place is outside town and its better if you have your own transport. Its on main highway so you can visit easily on your way to/from jaisalmer.

title: Amazing efforts been taken
review: Excellent idea of show casing and narrating the stories of our actual heroes to public. Very well maintained. Has a cafeteria also with a decent menu.

title: Memories of war
review: This is a wonderful museum located near jaisalmer city way to jodhpur road.  Developed by  Indian army BSF n other forces.  So many tanks and gunz are here to visit.

title: Great Tribute to war heros
review: it is a great place to learn about the historical milestones achieved by the soldiers... great artifacts of the kargil war are the main highlight of the place.

title: Felt Proud
review: The war museum manages to show various events of Indian defence forces. They have detailed narrative about various key folks and events. They have also kept lot of items at display.

title: "Salute our True heroes"
review: This museum is located at a distance of 10 kms from Jaisalmer, on the high way. Entry free, but need to show one ID proof at the security gate. This place is a tribute to all soldiers who made the supreme sacrifice. This consist of open area having different tanks, video room and  showcases the glorious history of the Indian Army. There is a place, we can request pen and paper and endorse our feel and would find them displayed in notice board. This place has a cafeteria, drinking water and wash room facilities.   Please do take your children to this place and that would be one of the best way to cultivate patriotic spirit in our future generation.

title: A must visit for every Indian
review: War museum experience is heart warming. Please take some time and see the pictures, displays, models, writeup panels. You feel proud of our army and the pains they are taking to keep us safe. Hats off. Ensure your children reads the literature and understands the significance of army.

title: Top tourists attraction
review: JWM is one of the top tourist attraction in Jaisalmer. It is approx 10 from the city towards Jodhpur highway. A classic tanks and ammunition are on displayed which was captured by our great Indian Army from Pakistan during 1965 & 1971 war. It is very well manage by the Indian Army. Kids will love to see the real tanks and other ammo including the fighter plane.

title: JAI HIND - SALUTE
review: We visited Museum travelling from Jaipur to Jaisalmer, around 10km before the city. Its wonderful place and must for every Indian particularly children and young person. You can see tanks and weapons, and we were lucky to see latest war machine on temporary display. We had wonderful food at Cafeteria run by ex fighter pilot.

title: Wow. Jai Hind
review: What a experience it was for me and my family. The detailed tour with a army guide gave such a sense of pride , moist eyes and salutations to our great jawan. The main idea was to take my kids and have them listening to our Fouji's great valour. Jai hind

title: Great  war museum. must visit
review: Its a place to visit by every proud indian. while on the way from jaisalmer to jodhpur, we took a break at this museum which is just next to road. though it was supposed to open gates at 9 am, and we had reached at 8 am, the sentry on the gate politely opened the gates for us and allowed us entry. its a very beautifully maintained, clean museum depicting memories of longowal war..

title: Interesting and very very educational
review: The best pizza my wife has ever eaten was at the cafe attached to the museum. Worth a visit just for the pizza alone !!!!!

title: Pride of India - War Details to look for.
review: 1st Most Imp. Thing

title: Pride
review: this place is must visit if you are in jaisalmer. our kid enjoyed a lot. you can witness the memories of indo-pak war

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: It exhibits the old and new equipment of Indian Army. It illustrates the great battle of Longewala.   It is a must visit place and pay tribute to our great Indian Armed Forces.

title: Proud indian
review: Wonderful to know the work done by army. There is a display section where army people explain the weapons used with meaning. Came to know why we are safe today. Must visit. carry your id card for entry

title: Good place to visit
review: definately visit here one time at least, it gives a good view of our braveheart soldiers and our achievements.

title: A Refresher Vist
review: A lot needs to be done in terms of "quality" and "variety" by the armed forces, to retain this project in the same level at what it was visualised as during it's inception.

title: Indian Army War Museum
review: Being an Indian I just can't give less than 5 star for first ever war museum of India.

title: Nice Warhead Museum
review: 2nd most attraction after the Tanot Devi Temple/Longewal,in Jaisalmer, very polite & ground to earth our pride Armyman, eager to explain you about all weapons lime M.M.G/Rocket Launchers,Arjun Tank, Bhisma Tank, Radar Device Vehicle, and lots of more, alongwith story of Indian Army,and must see  abandoned Vehicles/Tank of Pakistani left over/captured by our Army  during 1971 war at longewal border.

title: Must Visit!!
review: I visited this place in Jan with my family. There was exhibition going on  in which we got to see latest weapons, well explained by Army officials. Nice information regarding previous wars. There is also a souvenir shop where you can buy nice gifts.

title: surge of patriotism.....
review: I thank my friend who informed me about this war museum as it was not in ma list  earlier.Well built,very informative,friendly army men a must place to visit.The best part is souvenir shop dere u can buy jackets with army logo i also bought one.dey also show movie of indo-pak war n u can feel surge of patriotism.There were war tanks on display n also dose which seized from pak during 1965 war.Cant explain d feelings,proud to be indian.........

title: Worth visiting if you have a few hours to spare
review: We had some free time, having finished the fort visit, desert trek, etc. We were therefore able to make this visit to the war museum and return to Jaisalmer in about 3 hours flat. A well kept museum with noisy visitors who don't mind climbing on exhbits like airplanes to take photos and selfies!

title: Must visit
review: Was on my back to jodhpur. The museum is just 14 Kms out of jaisalmer. They have tanks and airforce jets too.  They have a video show of ten minutes which is good.  Well kept and maintained by the military. They also have some Pakistani tanks which were captured during war.

title: Worth Visit
review: Museum is on our way back from jaisalmer to jaipur. It is a nice place and worth  a couple of hours. This museum has tanks and fighter jet. Some tanks are from pakistan captured during the war. You can click good photos standing very close to these tanks and jet.

title: Patriotic Feeling..
review: It was one of the main attractions which we could able to visit during our trip to jaisalmer. We all felt the amazing feeling of proud indian

title: A must visit for every patriotic Indian visiting Jaysalmir
review: When you  enter the arched gateway to the war museum you are greeted with patriotic songs  which stir the proud  emotions towards our motherland. The exhibits remind  us of the brave souls who gave up their today so that we are able to live and breathe the freedom  that they have paid with their lives. It was touching to see the very weapons that were used by our brave solders  for winning the gallantry awards. There are Displays dedicated to each of the wars fought by our nation. The exhibits of  our tanks and those captured by us are also informative

title: war museum - a definite place to visit in jaisalmer...
review: display , as of now, includes tanks/specimens during the indo-pak war; only part of the museum is operational, the rest of it is still being planned/constructed on adjacent land. located about 12km prior to jaisalmer city on the pokaran-jaisalmer highway. we salute the bravehearts who laid down their lives fighting for the country, because of whose sacrifices, our borders are secured. needs further planning and much improvement though. best wishes...

title: collection of Indo-pak war details and contribution of indian army
review: Its one modern historical war museum which mainly cover proud history of Indian army. Its mainly collection of details which include combat operations during indo-pak war of 1965.

title: Salute to our BSF
review: A very good place to see in detail. Must carry camera. Must visit the audio visual show. BSF jawans are there to share informations.

title: Must visit for Jaisalmer visitor
review: Its must visit place and en route to Jaisalmer while coming from Bikaner. Its very well managed by Indian army. Do carry ID proof while visiting here. Salute to Indian army !!

title: Feel proud of your army
review: War museum. Must visit while in Jaisalmer. The eager staff tell you each detail of the arms with great pride. Also has a souvenir shop to buy great T-shirts, Sweatshirts and other stuff.

title: Just outside Jaisalmer, nice 30min stop
review: We drove from Jodhpur to Jaisalmer. Towards the end of our journey, just outside Jaisalmer we stopped at this museum. It was a great idea. Many Indian and Pakistani (Captured) tanks and airplanes are on display. The history of the Longewala battle is depicted through pictures as well as models. Best part is a short video film with REAL FOOTAGE of the historic 1971 Indo-Pak battle in which we gave a fitting answer to the advancing Pak army by squashing their plans. Kids enjoyed a lot and took lots of pictures with Indian tanks (barrel up) and Pak ones (barrel pointing down).

title: Excellent Museum
review: Very well maintained and has a very good collections of tanks and different gun used during Indo-Pak war.

title: Good throwback to history
review: Place must visit to know some untold stories of war took place between India and Pakistan. Young children should be shown this place.

title: Must for every Indian
review: There is no question of time in hand. Its an honour and a must visit for every Indian. Our martyrs deserve this from us.

title: A proud feeling!!!
review: THhe museum surely brings out a very good and patriotic feeling. The guide explains all the details abt the uniforms of soldiers, different wars , weapons that our soldiers use etc. We were shown a short film. There is a shop where you can buy stuff  that had Indian army's slogans etc. A very nice place to visit with family and kids.

title: Beautiful, Must visit place
review: Beautiful place, a must visit. Nicely managed and built by Indian army. Depicting the hard work and supreme sacrifice of our arm forces. Food is also good. Kids will love the army tanks and plane on display.

title: Goosebumps assured !!!
review: Must visit place when in Jaisalmer. A pretty good history lesson if you are not well versed with recent Indian wars. Very well planned and maintained, detailed exhibition of equipment/tanks used.

title: Pride of jaisalmer
review: I think jaisalmer is very lucky to have a army based museum, glorifying facts and martyrdom of our soldiers, portrait and live tools, tankers etc. A must visit

title: Great place
review: few KMs away from jaisalmer city

title: MUST VISIT
review: You can cover this while going to jaisalmer or coming back. this right on NH. You must see the movie shown there. you will be amazed to see the exhibits there.

title: Monument to our Bravehearts
review: This is a wonderful place - you can learn all about all the wars the Indian Army fought, both before and after Independence. You can see the old and new weapons, uniforms, learn details of specific operations, and see pictures of Param Vir Chakra and other award winners. IT's a great memorial to our heroes both fallen and living.. you will feel your heart swell with pride when you visit. Also see the tanks used by our Army, and the captured paki tanks. Great experience. Must-visit!

title: Must Visit .
review: This is a Must visit Lot of Knowledge you gain from this place about the war that happened years a ago in 1970.There is a 15 mins movie that gets played which is very informative about 1970 war worth knowing ..

title: Must Visit
review: Jaisalmer war museum is on the highway.You can cover it while entering to Jaisalmer.Very well maintained.There are many tanks,war trucks and fighter plan models on display.Worth visiting.

title: Patriotism
review: On the way to Jaisalmer we got the chance to visit War museum. We where very thrilled to see the tanks fighter plane and other war trucks.  We also went inside the tanks and see the inside parts.

title: Very Good
review: Very well maintained. Stuff at the canteen is limited and priced on an higher side. Momento shop collection is good.

title: Awesome..worth watching
review: The Jaisalmer war museum is on the outskirts of Jaisalmer. It is well build, clean and maintained by the army people itself. There are many tanks and fighter plan models on display. The audio visual show is also great. It also has a small cafeteria and a souvenir shop. The flag hoisted high in the ground looks amazing. It was a nice experience.

title: really a best place in jaiselmer, worth visiting
review: really a best place in jaiselmer, worth visiting, much better than jaiselmer fort , which was  so dirty

title: Nice collection
review: This place is on the highway to the Jaisalmer. It has got Indian tanks, planes etc which were used in battle of Longewala. Patriotic music is played. Tanks etc captured from Pakistan are also displayed. It should be high on the list of places to visit.

title: Best place to see the war memorial
review: Is it a very nice war memorial in Jaisalmer.

title: A good place to visit just on the outskirts of Jaisalmer city
review: Before you enter this place you would definitely be lifted with the melodious Manoj Kumar movie songs which creates a nostalgia within yourself. The museum has been well maintained by the Indian Army

title: Good place
review: Good place to start Jaisalmer as it is on the way to city . Must visit . Good for all ages . Kids love this as they can see tanks and all

title: greate experience
review: every Indian feel proud after visiting this jaisalmer war museum. good collection & place to know about varies war.

title: Salute to jawan,,,amazing to experience their tough journeys
review: Do dedicate some time to visit this amazing war museum, which captures the epic center of the 1971 war and more...

title: Must Visit for the Patriotic
review: The Museum is a good initiative to showcase the military history of India and also has a short audio-visual commentary on the 1971 war. However, it can be and hopefull shall be improved.

title: Amazing place
review: A must visit for every Indian. The way everything is displayed, our wars, our wins, our pride.... Beautiful place. A request to everyone, pls be respectful of our soldiers. Pls don't treat the museum as a photo studio with props. This is the least we can do. Pls do take a guide.

title: Felt Proud while entering the Jaisalmer
review: A must visit place for every Indian , you feel proud being an Indian . Also its a tribute to our brave army .

title: WOW.. what a spectacle...
review: Good ones..

title: Excellent place which makes every Indian proud.
review: They should have more halls covering what all Army does, accomplishment of our Army. Common/civilian folks have very limited knowledge about army.

title: Must Visit to know the post-independance war history of Indian Army.
review: Very well maintained, neat and clean maintained by army. An example of why the Indian Army is such a professional organization. A must visit to learn about the war history of Indian Army

title: EXCELLENT WAR MUSEUM
review: Our family very much enjoying this museum spicily our kids very much  like  and take lott off pics EXCELLENT WAR MUSEUM

title: Worth watching
review: This place has many army tanks and other war memorials. Everyone should step inside to see our soldier's effort.

title: Truly Patriotic
review: Audio visual show was ver good. Well managed museum. Very clean and well maintained. I touched the war tank first time in my life.

title: Wonderful
review: It is on the highway. You can cover while entering to Jaisalmer as it will save your time. You must visit at once.

title: "One of its kind war museum"
review: Nice place at Jaisalmer outskirts, has collections of war time tanks, etc. Remember to watch 10 mts movie covering war moments. Salute to our Great armed forces.

title: Excellent display of Arms, Battle vehicles and a good video presentation!
review: A must place to visit, especially with your children. This museum provides very good history lesson about the wars fought by our great nation and it's details. It also hosts a very good restaurant, souvenir purchasing section, an indoor and outdoor museum and a video presentation.  very good Parking place is available and the entry fee is nominal. It also displays our tanks and some of enemy vehicles from many of which our army has captured during operations. Proud to be Indian!

title: An excellent memorial to honour our brave soldiers
review: Reading through some of the letters on display here and other memorabilia will bring tears to your eyes. The memorial is a work in progress. It will get bigger and better once Phase 2 is ready.

title: Great place, must visit..
review: Brilliant place to visit.. Had good history specially nice memories of Longewala and 1971.. Amazing place for kids, well maintained.. Great specimen of tanks etc.. We should have more of these

title: U can't miss this place if u r driving to Jaisalmer
review: It's located just on the highway to Jaisalmer. Entry can be made on basis of tickets after showing ID proof. It has a museum displaying memoirs from wars and some big defence machines for display. Clean toilets and arrangement for drinking water. Not to miss the cafeteria. Also like to mention that after this museum there wont be any better place to halt until u reach your camps.

title: Must Visit Place
review: A Must visit place during Jaisalmer tour. The War museum is dedicated to the 1971 War between India and Pakistan. During the visit, you also get to watch a real Movie of this Indo-Pak War.

title: Nice
review: Nice stop on way to jaisalmer.speaks quite a bit about about history.both Indian and Pakistani tanks.

title: Fantastic window into what our army does for us..
review: This was one of the best places we visited in our trip to Jaisalmer. The place is maintained beautifully and the people on duty welcome you with a smile. One can feel their chest swell with pride as you walk around this museum

title: Indian defence force at display
review: Nice experience to see all defence equipments. Indian Tanks, airforce flights all used in 1965 and 71 wars. Pakistan tanks captured during the war was another prime attraction for my son.

title: Jaisalmer War Museum
review: One must visit this place during their visit to Jaisalmer. It is 9 Kms from Jaisalmer. During this visit, one must see the 15 minutes show run by the Army personnel. Otherwise nice experience to see the various action taken by the army and air force to safe guard our country.Particularly Battle of Longewala one of the major engagement by the western sector during 1971 indo pak war.

title: Relive 1971 here
review: Situated 8-10 kms from Jaisalmer this is the place to be for those who want to delve into the history and have a look on the machines used in the 1971 war. Very beautifully and systematically maintained by Indian Army. An amzing place to take pics and selfies, you can ride over the tanks, jeeps etc which is otherwise impossible for a layman. A restaurant is also there where you can try out some food or snacks. Stories related to many things are also written, a Big yes for those who want to get more information about the war. A nice place to visit.

title: Glorious memories of our pride-Indian Defence Services-Wow
review: You just cannot escape the main highway roadside attraction of entering into the glorious memorial called JAISALMER WAR MEMORIAL...sprawling campus, loaded with descriptive mention of the Heroes of Indian Army, collection of various tanks, trucks, guns, aircrafts caputered during the war..such a heroic feeling you have when taking a round of the memorial..

title: Must watch War Museum
review: Just 12 kms before Jaisalmer this newly started War museum is a must visit for every Indian. It depicts the valour with which our Defense forces fought the Longewala Battle against Pakistan. A short 15min Video is shown every half an hour.

title: The devotion of Hind Arm Forces for the Country
review: When entering or existing Jaiselmer this place is on the highway. This is the place where a civilian can understand what all Army, Airforce and Navy have to go through, how much they let go they sacrifice for there country and there is no limit to it.By reading some of the letters from javans to there families my eyes filled with tears. I salute the brave souls of our country of past and present who are always there to protect us. God bless all them and give them strength. Jay Hind

title: amazing experience
review: we were not sure if we would be able to visit the war museum even though we wanted to. Due to the fog we got delayed in leaving from Jaisalmer and hence decided not to visit war museum but as we came closer to it - we could not stop ourselves and ended up going inside.

title: A mesmerising war memorial
review: It is indeed an experience to visit war memorial museum at Jaisalmer. It also has a small theatre where they show war movies and a museum. They have also displayed tanks and aircrafts from the earlier wars with Pakistan.

title: Well maintained and quite knowledge giving creation
review: Short movie and brief history along with some nice pics in a quiet environment with a lovely cafe for economic, healthy food.

title: Informative For Kids About Army
review: This is located on the main road between Pokran & Jaisalmer.

title: Wow - Awesome & a must visit for those who feel Proud of Indian Military Forces...
review: Of-course, you should be proud of Indian military forces if you want your visit to Jaisalmer War Museum turn meaningful.

title: Salute
review: A well made museum on history of Indian Army. It has script and pictures of wars fought on Indian soil and won by Indian Army.

title: We lost the opportunity to watch
review: We could of seen the lack of time.

title: MUST see !!!
review: We had been to this newly come up WAR MUSEUM..nicely done up..there's a tea coffee shop,museum of preserved belongings of our great soldiers,a short documentary of 15 minutes is shown with a small entry ticket..

title: Salute to Indian Army
review: Jaisalmer has been a critical base for Indian Army for quite a long time. This war memorial is dedicated to the Army and its achievements. It is a nice showcase about the heroism these heroes do for us, so that we can live at a peace.

title: Just ok
review: It is on the way to Jaisalmer so you can stop and look around. Some old tanks, planes, abandoned trucks are kept in the museum.

title: Very spic museum
review: Though its not a particularly large connection but it's betty well maintained and guilt. The short film on the 71 war is quite indicative too. Overall this is an interesting place too visit fort Indians and foreign toward alike.

title: A Must Visit !!!
review: The Jaisalmer War Museum is on the way to Jaisalmer a little out of the city.

title: Must visit
review: Its on the way to Jaisalmer. Irs nicely kept and maintained. Holds memorabilia from the 1971 war. Most of them belong to longewala museum. You will find army jawans doing each and every activity from painting to maintaining the lawns on their own. Worth a visit.

title: Excellent place to visit
review: It is a newly built museum . excellent place , patriotic feeling ....the history every indian must know. a must visit place .

title: a good visit
review: was great to visit as one payed homage to our heroes. good description of the wars. some tanks are on display which were used in the wars . a nice big memorial for our heroes. jai hind

title: Great attraction
review: This is a place which is must visit. It is on the way from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur.

title: Must visit
review: Its on the way to jaisalmer and is worth the visit

title: Well maintained and great to visit place
review: The War Museum is an excellent place to check out the evolution and history of the Indian armies right from the times of Ashoka. The weapons on display though are more of the modern times. The place also has on display trucks and tanks captured by Indian forces at the Battle of Longewala one of the historic battles where a small force of Indian soldiers punished a much larger Pakistani attack of tanks, field guns and foot soldiers.

title: Excellent. Top class and a must visit place.
review: This place should be visited by every Indian. The memories of the valiant soldiers who laid down their life for the country during the 1971 war is still fresh. Tanks seized from Pakistan is on display. You can buy Army emblazoned caps for Rs.200/- and T-Shirts for Rs.380/-. The detailed description of the war from 1947 onwards is a must read. Very motivating

title: Victorious Presentation
review: One of the excellent place of visit which one must look at while in Jaisalmer. It shows how Indians fought the War through lots of difficulties and how they defeated the enemy through their moral and warfare methodology. Excellently preserved weapons, tanks etc

title: A must see, great place
review: On the highway about 20 kms before Jaisalmer, a great place where you can get educated about the history of the wars, pay tributes, read about courageous martyrs who laid down their lives for us, watch a short clip about the battle of laungewala and take lots of pictures as memorabili. conceptualised and maintained by the army, hats off to the armed forces for providing this facility to the civilians. A place where patriotism   flows everywhere!

title: Unique modern war relics and arms
review: Modern war relics on display. Arms ammunition, tanks and plane on display.

title: War Museum
review: Great experience, one should visit the War Museum maintained by Indian army. Well kept and has lots of intresting things to see

title: awsome
review: must go its very nice army museum . you will get goood photoes and u will enjoy there surely go there

title: A place you must visit to know the glorious history
review: Great place to visit with family. It has tanks and hunter jet in the premise for people to see and you can even climb on the tanks and feel the metal. Although disassembled but you can go inside the cockpit of the tanks also to feel how our soldiers sit inside the mammoth. Feeling very proud of the soldiers of our country.

title: Good
review: If you have time and interest about the 'army', 'war'. Then it is worth a visit.

title: A Salute to Indian Army
review: Maintained and run by Indian Army, it's a great Museum tells many heroic stories of our great soldiers. Short video is great to watch. Museum also has a sovereign shop with nice articles, caps etc.

title: Feel Proud
review: I Visited this Place twice in 2 Months, and every time I feel proud.

title: Felt honored to be there
review: It was a very good museum with excellent presentation of the past.  The souvenir shop also has very good collection and is also not very pricey.

title: Very well maintained. Truly inspiring! A must Visit
review: Felt the pride and my respect for the armed forces increased many fold. There is an impressive display of the armed forces feat & heroics over the many wars pre & post independence.  A must visit.

title: Must Visit Place
review: The Jaisalmer War Museum or called JWM, is one place to see the items capture during war by Indian army and see the proud heritage and a glorious history of Indian army.

title: Excellent museum, must visit to see the Battle Tanks up-close
review: This was a surprise stop on the way to Jaisalmer. Having been always fascinated by the battle tanks, seeing these beasts out in the open was a warm welcome to the war museum.

title: Excellent Museum
review: Excellent Museum worth going and should encourage people to go for sure. The history and the items on display are simply super.

title: Must Visit for every indian
review: Superbly built and a nice collection by the indian army. Hatss off to their efforts and the 15 minute movie is really a goosebumps giver

title: A nice display of bravery of Indian army
review: It show cases the bravery & exceptional courage of Indian army during 1965 and 1971 Indo-Pakistan war.Captured Pakistani army Tanks,Hunter fighter plane used by Indian air force and many battle field equipment are nicely displayed.A must visit place for all to salute Indian army.

title: Guite a sight
review: Its a cemetery for kings and qhite interesting to wander around for an hour.Not much in English explanation but quite beautiful.

title: Jaisalmer War Museum - A Must see along with other favorite Attractions
review: This is a unique and well laid out Museum complete with an AC coffee shop and a Souvenir corner. It has audio guides as also an small theater where a short film on the history of the War Museum and the battles fought is well brought to fore for indeed hair raising and moving moment.

title: A must for every Indian
review: You will be missing a lot if you miss this one. We spent good 2 hours here feeling proud and thankful.

title: A MUST VISIT
review: Nice place to visit. Very hospitable and courteous army personnel. A small movie is also played there to make visitors aware about the history. The quality of photographs and description given is quite good. Considering the climate generally prevailing there, the super chilled drinks in the cafeteria are an added attraction.

title: War Museum
review: Opened just a month ago, the War Museum showcases the Battle of Laungewala - for someone like me who didnt know - thats the Battle shown in the movie Border. A 15min video take your through the trysts of the battle and makes you feel how small we are in front of the Martyrs.

title: New on the map - Visit to get your patriotic streak ignited!
review: It is located about 25 kms from Jaisalmer and on the way when you are travelling from Jodhpur. Spend an hour at this place to learn about the 1971 Ind Pak war. The video they showcase at the start of the tour is really educating.Worth the 25 INR entry fee. Lots of artifacts captured during the war are on display here.

title: Pride of India
review: It is latest attraction in Jaisalmer and a Must watch for all the visitors to Jaisalmer. It shows the strength of Indian Army, their victories and contribution to the nation during time of need. Very good initiative by the ministry of defense (of India).

title: worth visiting
review: if you visit jaisalmer pls take time & visit the Longewala war memorial its a 2 hr drive, pay your homage to the brave soldiers who defended this post during 1971 war.

title: Great experiece
review: his army museum offers you a visual treat by displaying the vintage equipment used during the Indian wars tanks, weapons, guns, military vehicles etc. Good place for visit.

title: Must see
review: Bring tears to your eyes when you see relatively new but beautiful museum that provides sacrifices made by Indian armed forces in varius wars with brief history.

title: A Must Visit
review: Very well laid out, neat and clean, spotless clean place a typical trade mark of Indian Armed Forces, one gets transported to a different world on entering any Army establishment, as they are so well presented.

title: Very interesting
review: A small museum, partly in the open air. Very good explanations in excellent English. Displays include history of Indian Army from early days to now, WW1, WW2, Pakistan wars and the one with China. Lots of armoured vehicles outside from 1950's to 1990's and a Hawker Hunter on a pedestal. Spend up to an hour, it's only Rs30 entry.

title: Must visit
review: We visited here as we could not go to Longewala. This is a great war museum with huge collections and information. Visitors should not be allowed to jump on tanks like monkeys, it should be treated with utter respect. Must visit.

title: War Museum is FABULOUS
review: When you see the audio visual here it's sure to bring tears to your eyes. Indian soldiers are the BEST!!!

title: Related history
review: A beautifuly displayed kingdom essential . Old historical things can see here. Jaisalmer fort and houses built by yellow sandstone.

title: Salute to Forces
review: It is a must when visiting Jaisalmer. The Museum is maintained by the armed forces and is a must. There are tanks left by Pakistan Army as well as our own, the ones which we used. The   planes used by us. There is an audio-visual show (documentary). Unfortunately, they played 1965 was rather than 1971. There is a light and sound show however, since there were not many people the authorities decided to cancel it and it was one of the damp squibs. However, it was fantastic to be there.
